description:
I came here with a group on a Saturday evening. I ordered the Chicken with Garlic Sauce over Rice ($9.95). For each entree, you can choose whether you want it to be mild, medium, or hot. I ended up with the mild version. 

The mild version was still a little spicy. Not overwhelmingly spicy but enough for me to go through 1.75 cups of water.

The dish was not bad. There was a decent amount of rice and sauce. It was very flavorful and the vegetables did not taste raw. 

The service was quick. The waitresses would take away our empty plates and refill our water. 

There were a few awkward situations that happened though.

1. I was about to show the waitress the Yelp page that said we could get free soda with any entree if we check in. The waitress was quick to interrupt that only one person from a group of 4 could get a free soda. This seemed fine to me until we later saw the receipt charged us 25 cents for soda. 25 cents is no big deal but if you are going to advertise free soda on Yelp, you should be honest. 

2. After signing the receipt, we were trying to calculate how much each person should Venmo for their dishes. The waitress seemed impatient and kept trying to take the receipt away. We told her we were not done examining it and then she told us to use the customer copy receipt. 

3. One employee asked us if we wanted a bag since we packed food to go, so we said "sure." We then got charged 10 cents for a bag. I hardly see any restaurants charge extra for bags if we dine in. 

Other than that, everything was fine. The food was mostly good.
author: Kristina M.

description:
Check your bills. They somehow charge 30% in tax. I asked if that included gratuity but the server said no and couldn't produce an itimized receipt (we were in a large group and paid separately). They also charge 50% for credit cards but don't tell you upfront or have a visible sign posted.

Although this is nickel and diming it just feels unfair and shady. 

Also, food was average.
author: Deb B.

description:
I've been coming here for over thirty years. I keep meaning to try some other places, but... I keep coming back to Brandy Ho's.

The food is fantastic. The people are great! I almost feel like family. Patty, Selena, and the rest of the gang do a fine job. I've never been disappointed. Some of the kids I've watched grow up over the years. It's really great to see a thriving family business in these times of corporate chain hell.

I think that by now I've tried just about everything on the menu, and it's all good. My favorites: Hot and Sour Soup, Lemon Chicken, Honey-Walnut Prawns, and oh, wait -- I was about to list the entire menu! 

The Hot and Sour Soup is the perfect way to warm up after a chilly, foggy day in the Big City. (It's good the rest of the time, too.)

If you're into it, try sitting at the counter where you can watch the chef. It's  a little bit noisy at the counter, but terrific fun to watch the meals being prepared.

Try it! It's a little bit different than ordinary run-of-the-mill mall Chinese food, but different in an amazingly wonderful way! Verb sap. -- if you don't like spicy, tell your server when you order. Hunan food can be really spicy.

I love it!
author: Tom P.

description:
Excellent and authentic Chinese food.  Solid smoked duck!  And Salina will make you Amy killer drink you ask for.  Happy to come back.
(Frequent traveller from out of town)
author: James M.

description: Ordered through Caviar and this was just a hard no for me. I had the sweet and sour pork. The sauce was neither sweet nor sour. The pork was overcooked. I also had the green onion pancake, literally just tasted like batter. The peanut sauce that accompanied it was not even peanut sauce. Had no taste of peanut, only soy sauce... Also tried the lemon sauce shrimp. The lemon sauce didn't taste lemony at all, just sweet. At least the fried shrimp was ok. No MSG, for sure I'll give it that. Other than that, this place is a hard pass for me.
author: Benita M.

description: We had been meaning to check out Brandy Ho's for a while and finally made it.  We had the ultimate white person meal.. Hot and Sour Soup it was so good. Not thick. Lots of broth veggies very flavorful. Deep fried dumplings we would probably get them steamed next time but still good. Sweet and Sour Pork was delicious and a veggie dish it was great. Also great service friendly employees.
author: Susan S.

description:
I ordered Uber Eats from here so I probably don't have the most accurate review, and if I ever got the chance to I'd try it again in person. The food is generally really expensive for take out! The rice came in huge portions, so if you're splitting between two people one is enough.

Brandy's Dinner ($16.95) - Beef, scallops, and shrimp with bamboo shoots, onions, garlic, and bell peppers in house special sauce. Was a bit on the sour side. 

Lemon Shrimp ($12.50) - Crispy shrimp with a side of honey lemon sauce. The sauce was way too sweet for my liking.

Overall, the food was okay, but not impressive enough for me to order it again. I do like that they have MSG free options though.
author: Chelsea W.

description:
This is my go-to Chinese restaurant whenever I visit San Francisco.   They wok all of the food fresh on the spot in an "open kitchen," and you can watch them cook everything. It's pretty cool to see the giant woks working over massive flames. 

The food is all Hunan style, which is one of the Eight Great Traditions of Chinese cuisine - meaning it is hot and spicy, aromatic, and super tasty! 

The Honey Walnut Prawns are irresistible, as is the Brandys Chow Mein.  We also usually go for the General Chicken, and another random dish.  So far, nothing has really disappointed.  This last time we went for the Gon Pou and it was good, and seemed to keep getting better the more we ate of it. 

They will also serve up things like steamed tofu and rice for the little ones if you have them.  They also serve beer and wine, if that is your thing.  The hot tea is good and so are most of the soups. 

Beware, however, that during the dinner rush, this place can get extremely crowded.  It is frequented by tourists and locals alike. Fortunately they do take reservations through the Yelp app, so you can get a spot without too much waiting time.  We came here on a Saturday night around 6, just before they got totally slammed. 

Too bad they don't have more locations near me, because I would go here all the time.  Five stars.
author: Michael T.

description:
There's a saying in San Francisco that if you want to go out for Chinese food, you should never go to Chinatown because you'll almost always be disappointed.  Wanted to go out for Ramen on New Year's Day, but as the place, I had my sights on was closed, Brandy Ho's was an easy second choice.

The place was packed.  It could be because of not as many options, but given how many take-out orders and the constant turnover of the tables, I'm pretty sure this is a place to stop at when in the area.

Didn't really order anything fancy, but the food and drinks were plentiful (enough for leftovers), and my sweet and sour chicken was actually quite divine.  It's not one of those places where the nuclear pink sauce makes you question all of your life choices, but a proper sweet and sour that balances out the chicken and fruits/veggies perfectly.  I'll go back just for that dish alone, but the rest of the menu seemed like it was keeping everyone else happy as well.
author: Jes G.

description: Like Tom, I've been eating in this restaurant for at least 30 years.  Or 40.  I feel sorry for people who can only focus on the bill, and whether or not they can get a free soda.  Soda?  Who drinks soda with Chinese food?!  And if you have it delivered by a service, of course it will not be a good as if you go and sit in the restaurant and get it hot and fresh.  Go to the restaurant!  The food is great, always has been.  Really really good food.
author: Cheri C.

description: I have eaten here for over 10 years and I like it a lot. It also brings back so many happy memories. They also sell several of their sauces to go, so you can create your own homemade stir fry! the General chicken, lemon chicken, honey walnut prawns and the hot and sour soup are my favorites.
author: Alexandra B.

description: We received top notch service from Salina, Jack and Patty!!  The food was delicious. I highly recommend the fried dumplings, egg rolls, wonton soup and sweet and sour pork.  One of my Girl Scouts had three bowls of wonton soup!!!  It was served in a timely manner for our group of 22!!  I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting the area!!  I look forward to eating here again!!!
author: Dawne B.

description: I was in the SF for labor day, and was craving chinese food, so we decided to head to Chinatown for some good, authentic chinese food, we came across Brandy ho, the place wasnt packed at all, we ordered sweet and sour pork, chicken chow mein, and brandy ho fried rice, we were starving and started eating, the food tasted ok, not as authentic as I wanted, but halfway during dinner, my niece noticed that the chicken was RAW, bec we were so hungry we didnt notice it, and sure enough I cut the chicken piece in half and it was raw, ugh. I sure hope we dont get sick because of this. I couldnt believe my eyes , I wanted to throw up on the spot!!!!! it wasnt even busy when we came that they undercook the chicken, I am sick to my stomach!
author: Ann A.

description: My son and I went there because we had heard good things about the restaurant.  The steamed dumplings and onion pancakes were very good and tasty.  We ordered the dumplings medium spicy and were right on point.  My son ordered the General Chicken witch was also very good.  I ordered the chicken fried rice and Gun Pow chicken.  Both were under seasoned and bland.  The fried rice was over cooked like it was sitting for a while.  The Gun pow was not spicy or seasoned.  I can forgive the under spice a lot of people like bland food and it's hard for a restaurant to gauge the spice each person would want.  My problem is I even had to salt in both my dishes.  I was extremely underwhelmed even thou I went there excited to try a real Chinese restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Piyush P.

description:
I like this place!

They have these lightly fried oysters that I just die for. They lightly coat them with breadcrumbs, quick fry them so they are juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. Be careful when you bite them...........they get hot inside and the juiciness will burn you! They come with a salty, garlicky sauce you must drizzle on  to make complete. 

My other regular item is the triple delicacies. Had some fat scallops in there, shrimp were slightly small this time, but flavors spot on. They never use MSG and this time when I asked for it medium hot they actually made it spicy enough for me. Usually they look at me and think okay white girl, we know you cannot handle our heat.................YES YES I can handle your heat.....bring it on!

Best part.............they also have wine!
author: Yvette C.

description: A long-time customer just took me here. I don't know why it took me so long to enjoy a meal. The fried dumplings are great as advertised. So is the sliced ham stir fry - really unusual dish, I don't think I've seen it anywhere else. Perfectly located next to some of the best bars in North Beach too.
author: Jay N.

description: We tried several places and were able to make reservations.  Good food and service, enjoyable dinner.
author: Jason H.

description: Stopped in with my bf for dinner based on Yelp ratings and was not disappointed. It doesn't look particularly amazing but the food is fresh and delicious and plentiful. I recommend the steamed and fried dumplings.
author: Zeynep D.

description: Delicious. I had the Gon Pau lunch special with chicken. It comes with an appetizer assortment that had an amazing hot & sour soup that would make Bobby Flay proud with its spices.  It definitely cleared out my sinuses. The onion cake was really good also.  I asked for mild on the entree but next time I'm going for medium. Really friendly service as well. All in all a very nice place I will frequent again.
author: James F.

description: The calamari was amazing as was the General's chicken. Best late night Asian cuisine I've probably ever had
author: Suneye H.

description: Used to come here during lunch when I worked downtown. Really good food just stopped in to pick up some general tso's chicken! Delicious
author: Wayne S.

description: I was expecting something more delicious. The honey walnut prawns was the best dish we ordered amongst the rest. The brandy ho chow mein and fried rice wasn't great they use dark meat chicken and white. I don't like dark meat.
author: Princess Jasmine J.

description: Delicious food and fast service.   An elder of the community recommended the restaurant and it was delicious.  The sweet  and sour shrimp was fantastic!
author: Natalie M.

description:
I ordered to-go. It tasted very bad. It was definitely one of the less pleasant dinning experiences I've had with Chinese food. (Which I always thought you can't go wrong with) I ordered beef and scallop sauté and stir fry noodles as well as the crispy calamari.

Right before I started my meal, I found a huge bug in the calamari dipping sauce. It looked like it had been completely embalmed in the sauce for ages. It was drenched...I lost my appetite after that. And it's making me question if there is any sanity to eating out at all..
author: Sherica L.

description: The honey walnut shrimp was so good! The onion cake appetizer took about 3 mins to come out and was light and flaky. Friendly and fast service made this place so nice
author: Abel G.

description:
Ordered food to be delivered from this place with a couple of friends. We had an order of shrimp, general chicken, sweet and sour chicken, and chicken fried rice. Nothing really stood out as excellent, but of all the dishes I would probably say that the fried rice was my favorite. 

Nothing much after that really 'wow'ed me much, but was pretty run of the mill overall. One positive is that the pricing was very reasonable, especially considering the portion sizes.
author: Ryan R.

description: smoking duck was very salty.. and not worth it..calamari was good but these waiters need to be more patient. they just want you to order and leave not socialize or enjoy your drink..   not my fault they dont understand english. not sure if i would return
author: Alicia H.

description:
We've eaten here a couple times and the food is always fast, delicious and fresh. You can see them cooking your food! Lots of seating available and no wait.
Things to try: seafood combo appetizer, Brandys noodles and general chicken! Eating family style is a great option here as plates are large.
author: Marilyn R.

description:
I wasn't planning to end up here but I did. Was surprised to find that the food was OK, especially if you eat it hot and just out of the kitchen. Everyone in our party agreed it was better than expected and could easily have been worse. If I lived here I would get take out from here from time-to-time.

Service was very good and friendly.
author: J. Christopher E.

description:
This is an awesome chinese restaurant located right on the edge of chinatown that specializes in msg free cooking.

Parking is typical for SF in that it's street parking only which means that there is no parking, however there are some parking garages a few blocks away, and believe me since this location is just at the edge of chinatown/financial district you are not going to want to drive here anyway.

The restaurant has two entrances which can make the host/hostess job difficult as they get to cover both locations which are separated by the entire dining area. Wouldn't worry too much about it as most times you'll have no trouble finding a spot. There is a limited number of bar stool style chairs overlooking the kitchen prep area, but most of people there are waiting for takeout. The seating area has the standard tables and chairs-no booths-and offers decent ambiance. It's clean, decently laid out, and the lighting allows for a mellow mood set.

The food is good verging on great. Both the meat and veg dishes are decent if expensive, and it's possible to see great gouts of flame and the food being cooked from pretty much anywhere in the dining area. You will be out about 15-20 dollars for a meal per person which is not bad for the area. There are both cheaper and better places in and around chinatown, but there is no better place that has a decent dining area, has great service, with decent food. 

Recommended for the date night and also for the new in town tourist looking for something not terribly adventurous.
author: Steven W.

description:
Not horrible...just not really Hunan

My family of four visited here during our recent trip to SF.  We LOVE the fresh and spicy food that is the foundation of Hunan cuisine. But sadly it was not to be.

Oddly enough it was the Chinese food you can get anywhere that was best. The steamed dumplings, won-ton soup, and general's chicken were all reasonably tasty. But the Hunan dishes we ordered - shredded pork w/veggies, smoked duck, and lamb w/noodles - ranged from mediocre to bad. And it didn't seem to matter how many 'peppers' a dish was rated - it all came out mild.

In short, there are so many good restaurants a block or three away I can't imaging ever dining here again. But if for some reason you happen to find yourself eating here don't fear - just stick to the normal Chinese/American dishes.
author: Leo M.

description:
Brandy Ho's reminds me of one of those classic, well known restaurants which had its heyday like forty years ago and is still desperately clinging to it's nearly gone reputation. I didn't have as bad of an experience as some of the other reviews here, but I could definitely see where it could go wrong. 

We stopped in, in a group of ten on a Monday night and it was super dead. We ordered a variety of dishes, smoked chicken, smoked ham, spicy noodles, dumpling and wonton soups, shredded beef, and a bunch more. I tried a number of dishes and while I won't say that anything I had was bad, it was hard to recommend anything as good. I got my dish with the extra spicy option, which meant they just double the amount of spicy sauce it in, which was greasy and gloppy. The dumplings were thick and had a consistency which made me think they were frozen maybe twenty minutes before I ate them, which I think can be said for a number of the ingredients used.

On the plus side, the presentation is nice, the place is clean, the staff is attentive (I don't know if I would call them friendly as much as I would call them direct) and we didn't wait long. I feel like going here is a mistake as I know that there is much better Chinese food in SF. I have a feeling a well-minded, but not particularly food-picky, friend will drag me back here, but I can't really recommend it.
author: Nick M.

description: This is not the by any means the best food in a bustling China town scene, but the dumplings were awesome.  Everything else lacked flavor and did not meet up to the China town experiences i have had in the past.
author: Ryan O.

description: Our absolute favorite!  It's a must visit when we go to San Francisco. We've been going there for pot stickers/dumplings for almost 20 years.  The dumpling sauce is spicy- but they ask you what level of heat you want. Try it!  On our last trip (about a week long), we ate there twice!
author: A L.

description: The food is not horrible or gross at Brandy Ho's.  It's one of the tastiest Chinese food restaurants in San Francisco and the Bay Area.    I recommend this Chinese place to friends and family.   Been coming here for many many years as a customer.
author: Matthew C.

description:
This was the most less than mediocre, bland, overrated food I've had in ages. I cannot stress enough how blah and disappointing their food tastes.  Their service is completely below par (and we had delivery! It's not rocket science). I am not sure where this flavorful and delicious food is coming from in all of the other reviews but we clearly didn't get the same thing. 

My husband and I are from out of town and didn't feel like ordering room service at the hotel and the concierge said they are one of the few places that will deliver near us. I got a bad feeling on how this experience would go when my husband said the guy that answered the phone rushed him so quickly he could barely hear him and Mr. Ho hung up almost mid phone number and he had to call back. That was a call back we will forever regret. My husband somehow managed to eke our hotel name, our last name, and room number to the staff. 

The other sign from the stars we should've heeded was that the delivery driver's car broke down and since the man who spoke on the phone with my hubby wrote down our number wrong, we had to call and find out where our order had disappeared. Mind you, this was over two HOURS after ordering. I think it is safe to say that is pretty patient considering according to Google, our hotel is nine MINUTES away. We 100% don't blame the car because we completely understand that cars break. We aren't unrealistic. However, as mentioned, he knew our hotel, name AND ROOM NUMBER. where in that equation did it not occur to anyone that perhaps contacting the hotel to give us a heads up that our order wasn't coming did not add up? It seems like common sense to me to contact the hotel if you didn't even bother writing the cell number correctly. To our delivery man's credit, that poor kid sounded like he had ran a marathon to bring our order after we called. Granted, this is after 120 minutes of waiting and the man on the phone asking if we wanted to cancel our order..... no, we want our food. 

One upside is that I ordered cold noodles with peanut sauce and cucumbers. No, I'm not forgetting a protein part of the meal. That is literally it. Obviously I'm aware that I chose the order knowing there was no meat. However, I thought that even though there was no meat, there would be flavor. Sadly, my dish clearly came without that either. Or peanuts. Or sauce. What I did get was a medium portion of noodles (which were not bad at least) with the runniest liquid I've ever seen. It was literally light brown tinted water. Feel free to use your imagination on what that looks like.... I had to dig quite deep to even find a teeny tiny semblance of a slice of peanut. Maybe they swam away in the peanut "sauce"river. My generous husband donated a couple of his beef slices to try and alleviate the flavorless let down. At least the cucumbers weren't soft I guess. 

My husband ordered the beef with onion and wine sauce. He wasn't as disappointed as I was, but that isn't saying much. Never in our years of travel have we ever ordered Chinese food of any kind that doesn't come with a side of rice. Never. Maybe this is a San Francisco thing to charge extra for what provides a little flavor and texture to a meal but for the love of God, if you are going to up charge for flimsy paper plates, the least you can do is include some rice. 

Speaking of plates, as mentioned we are staying at a hotel so clearly we didn't have access to plates or silverware. My husband asked if we could have both. Of course! At 50 center a plate! We are not cheapskates. Money isn't the issue. The issue is charging people 50 cents PER PLATE. It's the principle. I could've walked down to the Walgreens and bought a sleeve of those cheap things for the same price. Way to nickel and dime people who don't have other options. Speaking of generosity, loving that you gave us a whopping three soy sauce packets, try to contain your giving nature this Christmas season. It would've been hard to clean up a small amount, had we spilled, with the two postage sized wafer thin napkins. 

As a special tribute to the two hour delivery, our dumplings were also a lukewarm, mushy "hot" mess. The flavor was about as good as my noodle dish. The sauce had the weirdest aftertaste that I can't even describe and clearly I'm not short on adjectives. Can garlic even be rotten? Is that possible?

It's a good thing we were able to wash out the flavorless dinner with essential fortune cookies every Chinese meal comes with. Just kidding, we didn't get those either. The lack of fortune cookie was indicative of the lack of flavor, service, and other necessities desired to enjoy a dinner. 

Needless to say The Four Seasons' concierge was made aware in no way could this place ever be satisfying enough for anyone who has even the tiniest knowledge of food and never recommend this place to any guests again. If you're skeptical, I uploaded pics. You can't please everyone, but I don't know how they please anyone.
author: Sarah M.

description: Ordered take-out from here, and ended up getting the hot and sour soup, and the sweet and sour chicken. The soup was different from any other hot and sour soup I've had, more spicy and a bit tangy for my liking. The sweet and sour chicken was delicious, however, and the chicken pieces were huge! Quantity for the price was definitely great. The wait was short, only about 5-7 minutes. We could see the food being prepared after we ordered it, so I knew it was fresh. Overall, great for a quick and inexpensive Chinese food experience.
author: Sonia D.

description: I had some time to kill while on vacation and have been looking for food Asian food past two times I visit. This place was fast, cheap, and a good assortment of dishes.  Cold noodles with peanut sauce, a dim sum (fried tart with chicken and slaw inside rather than dessert), hot sour soup, rice and Mongolian beef. Less than $10.  I was only there for lunch but this place was pretty outstanding for a short meal.
author: Ryan D.

description:
Grubhub delivered:  Pork Steamed Dumplings - beautifully constructed, had small bits of bone. $6.95    Beef with Green Onions - should be Tough Green Onlons with a Few Slivers of Beef.  $11.95  Hot and Sour Shrimp - 4 small/med. shrimp with and inordinate amount of large circular carrots, awful tasting. $16.45    Garlic Shrimp - 5 small/med. shrimp again with an excess of large carrots. $16.45   All these dishes were basically inedible.  The three entrees had similiar brown sauce, rancid oil taste.

Why is it so hard to find passable Chinese food in SF???
author: Rosie H.

description: We just drove in from Cali and found this hidden gem in china town, our waitress Salina was awesome the service was excellent .the food was delicious highly recommend this restaurant ! Next time we are back in San Francisco we will definitely be back . Thank you Brandy Ho's for a fabulous experience on my Birthday.
author: Jesse H.

description:
I knew the owner back in the 70's even though he has no remembrance of this! Now he is MEAN!!! 

I ordered the Sweet and Sour Chicken that I always order. It ALWAYS came within the sauce with vegetables with the sauce!! This time the chicken was in a separate  container over battered and DRY!! I HATE crusty dry chicken!!! Who likes that??? 

I also ordered the Cold Noodles because I love the peanut sauce that was always mixed in with it but there was NO SAUCE!!!! I called and the owner (who never gave me the chance to tell him he actually knew me because he is so ANGRY) yelled at me and first hung up on me!! 

Then I called back and he said he could not refund me because I ordered directly on his website! BS!!!! But he offered to give me cash but I had to drive to him on Columbus Street where there is no parking to get my cash!! I finally had a chance to go and get my cash today and I called and he again YELLED at me and said he would only refund me for the Sweet and Sour Chicken and again HUNG UP ON ME!!! 

Well you know what MR. HO???? I could careless about your refund! You have just turned in to a bitter old man and your food SUCKS!!!! I will never buy from you again and you can deal with your karma when you move on to your next adventure off this earth!! Bye!!
author: Yvonne J.

description:
Best Chinese food I've had, I have no idea why it doesn't have more stars.
Hot and sour soup
Fried dumplings
Pork fried rice 
Sweet and sour chicken
All was perfect and better than I could have expected!
author: Hannah M.

description: Probably the cleanest place to eat in Chinatown. Great place for groups and food was good. We got mild so it was a little bland but next time I would make order spicier so that it did have more flavor. Great service and environment!
author: Isabelle O.

description: The garlic smoked ham dish is a MUST. Trust me.  Don't leave without ordering it.....
author: Kim W.

description: This place hasn't changed and is still BOMB. Yes I used the word bomb. Ordered the smoked garlic ham which u normally wouldn't think, oh yum, but TRUSSSST MEE. Order it. And if you order Medium and you're white they'll look at you and ask you to reconsider. Medium is hot AF. Another MUST, the steamed and fried pot stickers. Best in AMERICA. No lie. I'm not going to say more. Also the beef green beans. To. Die. For.
author: Molly M.

description: Delicious appetizers and entrees. Friendly and knowledgeable wait staff.  Great to be seated next to the kitchen to see how efficiently they work together :)  Would be very happy to return and try more of their specialties.
author: Barbara H.

description:
Still THE BEST Chinese I've had anywhere.  Sadly, I only got to eat lunch there once this past visit.  And lucky us, we went on New Years Eve for lunch -- the place was empty.  We were able to watch the "Maestro" cook our food and he rocked as always.

Get the fried potstickers with garlic/ginger sauce.  The sauce is awesome!
author: Tim L.

description: The food was terrible, it was pretty empty on a friday night, we ordered the dumplings, house fried rice, house chow mein and won ton soup. All of it was terrible, the rice was the only edible thing, the waiter was mad we "ordered too much" when all the food was left on the table. we ended up eating snacks from our hotel room. He didn't offer any kind of discount  or apologize for the shitty food. do not eat here
author: Jennifer A.

description: I have never been in this restaurant before but was starving and looking for a place to eat. So many restaurants around, but no of them  Was attractive to go in.... finally I got lucky!!!! I get in Brandy Ho's and it was clean, fresh and nice inside, but it was closed for 30 more minutes, but Jack let me in, made tea for me and Ling took my order right away. Food are very tasty! Eould strongly recommend!
author: Yelena T.

description: This place was recommended by a co-worker and it did not disappoint! The fried dumplings were great. Every dish was awesome! The sauce on the sweet and sour chicken was the real deal.  Not of that fake pink stuff!
author: Erica L.

description: Came in late and ordered off Grubhub to our hotel room at Hotel Zephyr. Brandy Ho's..I asked my husband if his Ex owned it..hehe. We ordered chicken fried rice, honey walnut prawns and green onion pancake. Everything was so good. I wish I could have it tonight- But we're back home in Phoenix.
author: Melissa T.

description: It was only partly full on a midweek lunch and the crowd seem more tourist than local.  The food was also cater to American than Asian.  The hot and soup so was quite good, however the bread / naan and salad was not impressive.  It has an open kitchen which is usual for a Chinese place.  The spicy meat dish was not very hot so the Hunan part of the name is probably more signify the cuisine than actual spiciest.
author: Tony C.

description: Wouldn't order here again.  The food was pretty mediocre and there are tons of better Chinese food options nearby given it's close to/within Chinatown.
author: Allie G.

description:
The experience at Brandy' s started off great. We ordered dumplings which were fantastic. After that it started going downhill. Real fast. We ordered chicken with garlic sauce over rice and Brandy's chow mein. When the food came the chow mein was delicious. The chicken with garlic sauce not so much. It tasted like the cooks may have burned the sauce and I felt bad for my girlfriend because she couldn't eat it. I asked the waitress if there was anyway to swap out the entree because the chicken sauce was not good and we couldn't eat it. This is when it got bad.

The waitress said ok and then went to get someone who seemed like a manager. The manager then said nothing was wrong with the food. I told her that we couldn't eat it because it tasted bad and something seemed wrong. After a few more times of her trying to argue she said "ok fine. What do you want?" My girlfriend asked for the smoked pork over the rice and the manager said "you should pick something else. Do you want a menu?" My girlfriend agreed and then the manager gave her a menu and walked away without saying anything.
The manager never came back to us to get something ordered.

We waited about 10 minutes and then flagged down another waitress. At this point we were kind of annoyed so we asked the waitress to just take the meal off our tab and we would just leave. This waitress was incredibly nice and understanding. She gave us a to go box for my chow mein (which I didn't eat because I was waiting for my girls entree) and said she was so sorry for what happened. If it wasn't for her this experience would be a flat 1 star.
 
Minus the garlic chicken, the food was good, but how we were treated when we just wanted to eat at their restaurant was absurd.
author: David B.

description:
Stopped in with a friend for dinner. Service is friendly although my bud got a salad and he took one taste and asked if it had peanuts, which it did. Instead of offering to take it back they just left it on the table and we paid for it. 

My friend had a smoked duck dish. He said it tasted like plywood and he suspected it wasn't duck and I have to say that would be the smallest duck I've ever seen in a restaurant or market. I had cold noodles with peanut sauce (I'm not allergic) and the noodles were a bit under cooked and there was not enough sauce to coat all of them. 

We both walked out and agreed we are glad we tried it since we've walked by the place a million times but we also agreed we'd try other places before we came back.
author: Scott H.

description: Good late night (10:30pm) fried rice and vegetarian options after a round of drinks at nearby purveyors of cocktails. Open kitchen, clean and quick.  We enjoyed the fried dumplings as well
author: Michael F.

description:
1st time here
Ordered chow mein shrimp
Turned out perfect
The way i prepare it at home
author: Chef C.

description:
Last night in SF so wanted to try some SF Chinese food so went to Brandy Ho's. I was really looking forward to this dinner but walked away a bit disappointed. 

First off, I started with the egg rolls. Came three to an order and while they were very crispy and tasty, they were a bit on the greasy side. They came with a little dish of soy sauce which was okay but would have preferred hot mustard. 

Had the Brandy's Dinner for an entree and ordered it mild. There was a good amount of beef, scallops and shrimp in the dish and it was tasty but could have probably ordered the medium spicy as the mild was a bit too mild. 

My biggest complaint is how hot it was inside. Now, granted it was a hot day in SF but this was about 830pm and it was almost unbearable inside the restaurant. We were seated right by the open kitchen area which dos not help matters at all. The temperature inside effected the entire meal
author: David S.

description:
I have been here several times already. This 4 star review is based on today's experience. We did not get greeted by our usual waitress but some guy and gal dressed in black, maybe managers. 

Took them awhile to get our order, had to ask twice for forks, not for me, but my two coworkers. The food is good, hunan style chinese food. 

I usually get what my coworker gets, slice beef with veggies with brown rice. Special #1. Today I decided I wanted noodles, doesn't say chow mein or noodles in soup or stir fried, just noodles. To my surprise, they were in soup. They weren't bad, just surprised. My lunch came with soup, green onion pancake, cold veggies. 

If you check in on facebook, you get a free fountain soda. Which I did, had to prove it to him. 

Service was ok. It could've been better.
author: Eugenia W.

description: Brandy Ho's is a nice change from a lot of other eateries in the area. I have enjoyed this restaurant since the first time I went there, back in 2013. Ho's is the only restaurant in the Bay Area where I can order smoked Hunan chicken, which I think is one of the best dishes ever. So if you're in a mood for good Chinese food in the hub of so much San Francisco history, then this restaurant is for you.
author: Noah T.

description:
I used to love coming here.

I'd sit at the counter, so I could watch all the kitchen magic happen.  

Back in the day, late 80's, early 90's or so, this joint got mad attention.  I remember hearing about it on The Frugal Gourmet on PBS.  According to the chef, Jeff Smith, it was all about those dumplings.  "The best dumplings in SF...," he said.  I had to go.

I personally loved their spicy chow mien.  And the whole experience of sitting at the counter & watching the cooks just made me happy.

But then, something happened.  What exactly that was, I don't know.  The quality went noticeably down.  It went from very tasty Chinese to very mediocre Chinese.

And the stench of bug spray wafting through the restaurant, however mild it might be, is never a good thing.

I miss the old Brandy Ho's.  Please come back.

2 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
We usually go to Henry's Hunan but decided to switch it up this time! Brandy Ho's was good. We had the fried dumplings, General's Chicken, and egg drop soup. The fried dumplings and General's chicken were good, especially the chicken! But the egg drop soup was a miss :( very, very bland.

Service was friendly when I ordered for take out :)
author: Julia M.

description: Possibly the grossest meal I've ever had. Maybe it's because it was late-ish and they only dish out the dregs after a certain hour? My food came as soon as I ordered it, so I wouldn't be surprised if they gave me something someone else sent back. Spicy eggplant might be ruined for me forever.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Very good but not the top. The steamed dumplings were fabulous and the onion cakes are top notch. We had a variety of dishes, they are not cheap but all good. Shrimp fries rice was great.

We got medium hot and it was spicy. If you do not like real heat then go mild.
author: Jeff L.

description:
I've only ordered fake-out- but I live in Russian Hill and have a lot of great delivery options in the area--
Only Brandy Ho's is consistent (& quick!)
Combo fried rice: delicious.  
House garlic dish (you chose protein)- I asked for extra spicy and actually received extra spicy!!  That never happens.  And it was delicious too.  I poured this atop my fried rice.  Amazing. 
Fried pot stickers were only disappointment and what keeps me from leaving 5 stars.  They taste like grocery store pot stickers (and the gross veggie kind).  The outer/ fried pot sticker is definitely not store bought- but for whatever reason the ingredients inside just taste-- bad.  
But there are plenty of other options -- when I try more I will amend this write-up as warranted.
author: Kelly C.

description: My lovely boyfriend and I are also on a gluten-free diet, so we asked the server what dishes could we have, and he said they could adapt dishes with a gluten-free sauce. I took the waiter's suggestion and ordered the old country mixed vegetables with chopped broccoli. My wonderful boyfriend also wasn't sure so he did the same I did; asked the waited what was best and follow his advice, so he ended up getting the spicy beef with broccoli. The chef was very attentive, he made the fried calamari for us without any butter. The dishes were delicious and reasonably priced. A plus for those who are gluten-free.
author: Jennifer E.

description: Never ever disappoints. My family has been frequenting Brandy Ho's for the past 20+ years, and make a point to visit every single time we're in SF. My brother and sister in law even had their wedding rehearsal dinner here!! It's classic Chinese that's always tasty. Some family favorites include the fried wontons, lemon chicken, and three delicacies. Will always consider it our favorite Chinese cuisine in all of San Francisco!
author: Bridget H.

description: Went here with coworkers, which was backup after Z&Y had a long line. Didn't have much of a lunch crowd. The egg drop soup isn't what you'd expect, it was very homemade and has some veggies in it, which was a nice take on a classic. I don't think much of the food is very authentic... the steamed whole fish was pretty good though, plenty of green onions and ginger to steep in the flavor. Their version of ma po tofu was alright... not very spicy like Sichuan style ma po tofu, but had good pieces of savory ground pork. Most of the other dishes we got, calamari, spicy chicken with carrots, and chow fun and a vegetable platter could satisfy your Chinese food craving, but not the place to go for an authentic taste of Chinese cuisine.
author: Ke C.

description: Service was very quick and food was tasty, even though it could have been warmer upon delivery.  The onion pancakes need to have bigger pieces of onion in them, as well.  Interior could use a facelift and better lighting; it was a bit dark and almost dank.  Staff were quiet but helpful.  Maybe a complimentary dessert cookie or mint would have been nice after all the Hunan flavors.  This sounds critical but these are just minor flaws.  The food really shined.
author: Daryl D.

description: We had the Brandy fried rice, Generals Chicken, pot stickers, calamari, braised beef stew and chicken chow mein. It was soooo good. Definitely a place to try if you're in China town
author: Rachel B.

description: It is good quality simple Chinese, nothing fancy. I really love the Brandy's fried rice, it never disappoints. The dumplings are really good, the spice can be intense so if you are spice adverse ask for no spice. I like spicy and medium is pretty spicy. Delivery from Caviar is always good from Brandy Ho's too.
author: Leslie L.

description: Employees multi-task serving customers and wrapping dumpling without washing their hands. It's only a matter of time before their customers get sick from eating their food. Dumplings are good but they need to work on their cleanliness.
author: Lyn B.

description: THE BEST CHINESE FOOD I've had in a long time! OMG, the fried dumplings with ginger sauce are to die for. Everything is super fresh and authentic. I HIGHLY recommend! But he sure to make a reservation prior! This place is very popular because the food is absolutely AMAZING!
author: Miranda M.

description: The lines snaked out the door onto the street. It's Christmas night and there were many Jews dining (I'm one of them). The hostess was nice, even though she had people bothering her constantly. Our server was friendly, helpful, and quick. The food? We couldn't believe how good it was! Our bellies full, we left with smiles. We'll be back!
author: Robin A.

description:
Made a reservation for Christmas night because Henry's Hunan was closed and was happy that we did as the reception area was crowded with pushy obnoxious people that did NOT have reservations. We were seated promptly and the place was really busy and every table was taken. Our food was really good. We started with steamed dumplings both mild and medium spicy on the heat scale. The medium spicy were really hot in a good way. We also had the General's chicken, Green Beans with Chicken and pork chow mien. I would recommend all these dishes.
The service we received was really lousy. Our server just couldn't handle the hectic work load. We weren't in a hurry so it wasn't a big deal but other tables near us weren't as accommodating. We will definitely go back and recommend to friends.
author: Matthew M.

description:
We swung by tonight on the way home, hungry, just wanting some hot and sour soup and General chicken. Walked in and ordered takeout.

Less than 10 minutes later, we were handed a bag. Yay!

Except when we got home 10 minutes later and set out our plates. The hot and sour soup was gloopy and lukewarm. Popping it in the microwave made it hot, but barely improved the taste.

The General chicken was flavorless, just discs of cheap, bland chicken. Ugh. Such a waste of money. Horrible food.
author: Viviane V.

description:
My family has been going to Brandy Ho's for years for late night dinners. We love it! We usually come around 8-9pm randomly on both weekdays and weekends and are never disappointed. It's a bit hidden in Chinatown and parking can be tricky but it is totally worth it. 

They call it "Chinese/Asian Fusion" and I guess that is the perfect name for it. It's authentic Chinese meals but with a twisssst. The customer service is great; they are always so friendly and helpful when it comes to navigating the menu and explaining ingredients. Most of the plates are around $10 and everything is family style, so super cheap if you are splitting the bill.. 

Some of our favorites are:
Steamed Dumplings - these are the best dumplings you'll get in SF! *drools*
Si Foo Chicken with Black Bean Sauce
Gon Pao Chicken Hunan
Brandys Pork with Sweet & Sour 
Old Country Scallops
Special Fried Rice

We will always come back for more!
author: Brittany R.

description:
we had a really good group lunch there.  They have an area toward the back for private functions.  The event was for a friends 25th wedding anniversary.  We had about 10 dishes, with a few drink options.  Service was steady and professional.  A good balance of getting what we needed and staying out of the way.  Food was prepared non-spicy by our host, but they had sauces to make it the way you wish.  Wide variety of food.  Nothing stands out as they were all good.  Even the green bean dish was really good.  Will definitely come back.

However, I won't park at the lot attached to the Royal Pacific Motor Inn.  Slimy people.  They are professional hucksters.  Be wary.  Protect your car.
author: Clifford S.

description: I was excited to try this place because I've heard good things, but when my food arrived it was too spicy for me to eat. I ordered on Caviar and was given the option between not spicy, mild, medium, and spicy and I opted for "not spicy" everything. For a spicy food lover, it may have been great, but for me, it was $50 down the drain. Don't give people the option to order "not spicy" and then send them super spicy food! I can tolerate a little spice, but my mouth was on fire from just one bite of the broccoli chicken. The general chicken wasn't much better. Super bummed.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
Tuesday, May the 5th 2015.
What an outstanding place for Hunan cuisine! The food is great, excellent ambience and  an incredibly friendly staff. Be sure to tell your server the level of spiciness/heat you desire, they are very accommodating, we will be back on our next visit.
Jon Uditsky
Los Angeles
author: Jon U.

description:
I have been coming to Brandy Ho's with my mom since I was an baby in the 90s, and my mom has been coming since the 80s! It was a family tradition back then and it still is now.

Mr. Ho is always so kind to us. We love coming to this restaurant whenever we are in Chinatown!  Our favorites are the old country vegetables with tofu, the cucumber salad, and fried rice.

If you are craving delicious, traditional Chinese food in San Francisco, you can't miss Brandy Ho's!
author: Morgan B.

description:
I came here with my dad and really enjoyed this tasty dinner!  We started with the fried dumplings- A MUST- and then had General Chicken and Beef Fried Rice. All very yummy!
The dumplings are filled with pork and vegetables and are very big! There are six in one order and they lay a-top soy sauce. 
The General Chicken certainly was my favorite part of the meal! It is very tender chicken that is then fried and put in their "house" sauce with a few sesame seeds. The sauce is very sweet and savory! I could bathe in that stuff! The general chicken is served with steamed broccoli. (You may get dark or white meat chicken) 
The beef fried rice was also outstanding! Very tasty! I mean it's beef, egg, and rice, what could be bad?

I would recommend Brandy Ho's to anyone but I would recommend this meal to anyone who is a little picky when it comes to ethnic foods. Also this meal was not ordered spicy but it can be.
author: Shayna R.

description: What you would expect from a Chinese restaurant. A colleague made me try it based on his past travels to the area. I simply did not have the same experience he had. Food was simple and not any more memorable that a Chinese take away restaurant in a strip mall.
author: Jerry S.

description: I love this place. sure the decor is a bit tired, but the food is consisteltly good,
author: Bill W.

description:
You'll see a trend in the reviews: the food is delicious if you are drunk. But most food is. Well I was sober and maybe I tried the wrong dish...I had the Gon-Pou chicken. It was okay quality, but too sour for me like the bamboo shoots has been fermented too long. 

Might try again if it's the only option, but I wouldn't order anything with bamboo shoots in it again.
author: Jordan F.

description: Went here for dinner with some friends on a day trip to San Francisco. We did a lot of searching and asking locals. So we thought we settled on a great place, despite the neighborhood being sketchy. I have to preface this post with, having parents who own their own business too I have a tough time posting for anything less than 3 stars. The only thing, other than Yelp just doesn't allow it, that has this at a 1 star is the good service. However, unfortunately I have to report this was by far the worst Chinese food I've ever eaten. :-(  The Gon-Pou chicken (their version of Kung Pao which I get at every Chinese place I go to) smelled and tasted like, the closest thing I can think of is the sewer smell we smelled walking earlier by the piers. We aren't sure if it was the bamboo shoots or the chicken or both. The other item we ordered was the veggie chow mein. It was more edible than the other, but the grease had a bad flavor that made it not yummy. In the end, we filled our bellies a bit and left, but definitely won't be back.
author: M K.

description: Friendly service and fresh tasty dumplings.  Mostly tourists here which is not a good sign but they had the game on and the food did not disappoint.
author: L H.

description: The location is great, right by Broadway and a great place to people watch. I like the hot and sour soup the best. Their lunch special is not bad but it's mostly a place for tourists.
author: Peter L.

description: I came her on Chrismas night and I really enjoyed everything about it! I come here on Chrismas night every year! I really enjoy the chow mein and rice, and also all tat spicy food such as the spicy dumplings, and eggplants! I definitely think you guys should check this place out sometime soon as the food is really good!
author: Asher D.

description:
After the first few bites, I knew I should of went somewhere else. With the hundreds of excellent places around, the could of done better. 

Fist the good:

The place is clean and has a very modern look. 

They sat me promptly. 

The mediocre:

The food was a small portion than anywhere around. 

Bland. I had the garlic chicken, kinda hard to screw up, and I had to add soy sauce. It also had that undeniable burnt garlic taste. 

The bad:

Staff really rushed around for no reason and I felt unwelcome.
author: Melody R.

description:
This place used to be my favorite Chinese restaurant.  We ordered delivery tonight and it was so awful, I'm never going back.  Here's what we ordered:

First, Brandy Ho's Chow Mein:  The chicken tasted rancid - just awful.  The shrimp and beef were okay.  The noodles were dry.  The oil they used didn't taste good - like it had been recycled too many times.  I don't just love chow mein, I looove chow mein.  It takes a lot for me to have to be unhappy, so that's a sign that this one was subpar.

Second, Gon Pou Shrimp and Beef Hunan:  Ugh!  Totally disgusting!  I don't think any of the ingredients had gone bad like the chow mein.  It was just gross.  I think something's off with their recipe.  It had really awful smell and taste.
author: Negar A.

description: We were in Chinatown looking for a good restaurant and came upon brandy ho using Yelp.  The food was mediocre and tailored towards non Asians.  It was a Friday night and the restaurant was busy so our service was okay.  The waitress took forever to refill our water.  We did get our order and food quickly so that made up for it.  Being from out of town, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone who is visiting San Francisco.
author: Xai L.

description: I don't understand the bad review but I loved Brady Ho's food and service. I will definitely order again. Loved the tidy packaging of my food. Additionally, I used Uber Eats for my delivery. Loved the convenience.
author: Kathy S.

description:
Excellent excellent Hunan food in China town. I have been here many many times and have never once been disappointed. The food is superb, service is excellent and quick. Its' a nice casual (not divey) place that you can go with pals or family.

Must try the sweet and sour pork and the fried dumplings in garlic sauce!
author: Kabir S.

description:
I've been coming to Brandy Ho's for a number of years now, way before I was Yelping.  It's one of my "safe" spots, where I know I can consistently get good Chinese food.  The nice thing about this place is that it closes at 11pm during the week, where most other restaurants close by 9 or 10. 

The food here is Hunan style.  I don't know what that really means, except it's definitely not Americanized stuff you find at your mall's food court, and they do add heat to some dishes.  I would say the food here is very homestyle.  I mean it doesn't look like anything fancy, sometimes even bland, but don't be fooled -- The food here is delicious!

Service is always quick and friendly, and the prices are pretty inexpensive.  3.5 stars rounded to 4.
author: Jaszon S.

description:
So this place is on Eat 24, and after a long day of wine tasting in Napa (read: drunk)I was starving with no desire to move off my couch. I ordered from here and here's what I remember thinking: 
1) That was so fast 
2) This is so delicious : DUMPLINGS 

I ordered a ton of food, 60 dollars worth for a friend and I, but I ate it over the next 2 days. 

I ordered:
Steamed dumplings - very very good and reheat well. 
Fried dumplings - so so delicious and I'm usually not a fried food fan
A chicken dish - chicken seemed tough and over cooked, felt the same way when eating it as left overs 
Spring rolls - awesome texture and flavor with great dipping sauce 

In short: stick to the dumplings and spring rolls
author: Lauren A.

description: Brandy Ho's is HANDS DOWN my go to place for chinese food in SF. I cannot get enough of the string beans or eggplant. I highly recommend ordering family style, and bringing plenty of folks to share the dishes with you. It's fun to order different items and enjoy something new! I love the service--the owner is very kind and you can tell the whole family operation takes great pride in their restaurant. So yummy!!
author: Rebecca C.

description: Absolutely delicious food. Juicy meats, crispy vegetables. Very nice service. Nit cheap but worth paying for it. Great choice of tasty beers.
author: Agnieszka M.

description:
Good service, but below average Chinese food.  

This place seems a bit out of touch with the times and needs much updating.  That would be fine for a Chinese restaurant had it had fantastic Chinese food.  But it did not.  The food had flavors that were just a bit "off," and missing elements of the dishes themselves.  

If you want to get specific, I felt that they could not even get something as basic as hot and sour soup right.  It lacked spice and the vinegar used was just off. 

Too bad, as this place used to be iconic in SF.
author: Mark M.

description:
The food was actually good. Came down from Reno, NV for 420 and had dinner here after all was said and done. The staff was friendly and helpful. I'll be back.

3.5 stars
author: Sis. J.

description: Been enjoying the deep fried dumplings since 1986... Love this place... Food and service are the best !!!
author: Laura B.

description:
Brandy Ho's has been a favorite of mine since the 80's, and they still manage to make me happy!  But looking at many of the reviews, people order the least interesting things on the menu!  Their specialties (IMO) are the smoked duck and smoked ham stir-fries, which are amazingly tasty, smokey, spicy and full of crunchy vegetables.  The meat sauce noodles are chewy, rich and filling; the cold spicy sesame/peanut noodles are another favorite.  Curry shrimp stir-fry is so full of flavor and goes well with cold beer.  
I am also very happy with their service, and they do keep their place much cleaner than what you might expect.  Their open kitchen is really orderly and clean, and the flames and racket from the stir frying is fun to watch.  And Brandy is often there keeping his eyes on the ball.
author: Dennis F.

description: I've somehow made it six years in SF without food poisoning... until last night. In fact, I don't think I'd thrown up in over 5 years. Yet, there I was, clutching my porcelain throne for dear life as subpar Chinese delivery spewed out of a hole in my face. Was it the General's chicken? The fried rice, sans shrimp? Or was it the dumplings? I'll never know for sure. But I do know that I will never go near this place again.
author: Dan R.

description:
I was so stoked to show my  friends an old haunt so I brought them here.  We had Dumplings, Calamari,, Sizzling Rice Shrimp and he rest was a blur of Chicken and Beef.  If I had to sum it up in 1 word it would be - OUTSTANDING!.  

Truly a must do in SF!
author: John O.

description: Service and food were both amazing here. My husband and I were looking for a great Chinese restaurant in Chinatown. We stumbled upon this place. It was clean and immaculate in fact. Service was awesome. Food was off the charts good. I had lemon chicken. It was the best I've ever had. We will definitely be back.
author: Holly Q.

description: This place is the best chinese food in SF hands down, really good and spicy recommend that moo shu pork or how ever u spell it.Really nice customer service defenitly check this place out!
author: Marco M.

description: Lots of mess ups, nice server, shitty manager and the food wasn't worth it...sorry, house of Nanking is where it's at
author: Yadira A.

description:
Went here for lunch with a friend who has been here a few times, so had high expectations.. but that was not the case. Ordered one of the lunch specials which came with hot sour soup, cold noodle salad and an onion cake. I enjoyed those items more than my main dish which was a Kung pao type chicken dish. The dish was bland looking and too salty. 

The waitstaff was great and the only other plus at Brandy Ho's.  But unfortunately it will be a Brandy No more for me!
author: JA A.

description:
Came here with a party of 3. The decor was something out of the 1950s, and the decoration was contemporary Christmas; Some would see that as a detraction, I thought this added to it's charm.

Our waitress was friendly. I really liked the deep-fried wantons, as they weren't too fried, and the sauce they came in was absolutely delicious. It was hard to describe, but it was like your typical hunan spicy sauce, only more sublime and delicious.

We got Gong Pao Chicken, The sweet and sour pork, and the Brandy's Special. 

The pork was barely breaded, and was actually really good. I didn't like the Brandy's Special very much, but everyone else I was with did though. I loved the Gong Pao Chicken and S&S pork though. 

It's good to have a reliable Chinese spot in North Beach, and this is a good spot to get Chinese food that is a nice medium between American and authentic Hunan cuisine (which btw, in the menu, they have a nice little story about Hunan cuisine and their own restaurant).
author: Stevie D.

description: Best lunch specials in town! Prices range from $7.50 to $10.50.  Each meals starts out with hot and sour soup ( the best), onion cake or dim sum, and noodles with peanut sauce.  The onion cake and dim sum were bomb!  I ordered the gon pao spicy and my friend the garlic chicken.  Both were delicious! I would almost say the gon pao is better than Henry's Hunan.  Anyway I know they claim to not use MSG but I swear I went into a food coma after and could not stay awake.  I will be back for sure!!
author: La C.

description: I haven't been here in 11 years.  When I last came here, in 2005, I had limited cash and wanted to show my then-boyfriend the excitement of regional Chinese cuisine.  I promised him that Hunan would be exotic and delicious.  We ordered two small dishes.  One came out larger than the other.  I was excited.  They must have realized I had limited funds, as I'd been asking about prices, and been nice enough to offer me a large plate. That, or the entree was just larger on its own. We got rice on the side.  When I got the bill, it was more money than I had, because they charged us for the single rices on the side.  I was also charged for a large entree, when i had ordered two smalls.  The waiter didn't care and would not help me, instead dismissing my concerns and telling me that this was how much I owed.  I found the manager, who didn't want to speak with me.  When he was done having his casual conversation with friends, he gave me the slightest head nod.  I explained the problem to him, and he basically told me I was wrong.  I told him what I'd ordered, but he told me no, I had the large, and they charge for rice.  I never asked for a large, and I didn't have the money for it.  Nor did I have the money for the trick of charging for rice.  I remember the food being delicious, but from that moment on it didn't matter, because I would never come here again.
author: Rose P.

description: So happy! My favorite waitress ever PATTI still works here--she's great, ask for here! I still love Hot & sour chicken with brown rice. Don't be discouraged if you visited their spot in the Castro. The kids there never got it right. North Beach is their original location & it's still excellent. If you've had a rough night, this is the tonic. So good. Btw "medium" = spicy here. Deep fried dumplings are excellent as well. A true San Francisco classic-- No MSG!
author: Scott F.

description:
Excellent service, cold Tsingtao and amazing fried dumplings. I have never had Hunan food in China, so I'm not sure if this is "authentic" or something that is more geared towards Americans, but I thought that it was little different than your 'standard' Chinese takeout food.

-Fried meat dumplings in the house ginger sauce, extra spicy were the highlight of the meal. Perfect consistency on the outside and flavorful meat filling on the inside. Served in a stainless bowl and tossed in a ginger / chili oil / green onion sauce. Amazing.

-Beef and string beans ordered "medium hot." Good level of spice, and the green beans were very delicious. Cooked through but still crispy which really set off the dish.

-Gon pau chicken ordered "medium hot." This was our least favorite dish. The chicken was not that tasty, and my overwhelming recollection of the plate is that there were way too many onions in the stir fry and not much else.

I would definitely eat here again and maybe try some different items on the menu.
author: Steve D.

description: The food was amazing. It did not matter that the restaurant was out of several items we wanted to order because we really liked the ones we got. My friends and I shared family style and everything tasted great. First we ordered the fried dumplings and spicy beef, two my favorites. Try the pan fried dumplings, they are a must. Then we got the Hunan Duck and it was really good. The egg rolls were crispy and oily, terrific! I first ate at the old Broadway location in 1990, still loving it now as I did then! They have toned down the spice a bit over the years but still order cautiously.
author: Chloe B.

description: So disappointing.  We ordered  delivery and it is less than a mile to our house and the food was cold and not good.  What we ordered Definately wasn't what Chinese should taste like. Everything tasted like sweet and sour sauce.  Also the driver was very rude.
author: Judy M.

description:
Been coming here since I was a kid and still love it for lunch and family style dinners. Vibe is casual but more upscale than your avg Chinese joint.

I usually order:
Hot n Sour soup
Black Bean Chicken
Friend Dumplings
Onion Cake
author: Ron P.

description:
Our last night in SFO and we had a Georgia hankerin' for fried rice and other goodies...Hotel sent us straight to Bandy Ho's and they nailed it. Once my son and i got their to order TAKE-OUT we added a few more items, fried dumplings and chicken lo mien. 
The flavors were outstanding and fresh. Brady Ho took the flavors one step further than the normal Chinese food we've had in the past.. 
The restaurant itself was clean and comfortable and they even offered us a cool drink while we waited...
author: Jim C.

description:
The smoked duck was nothing but tiny bones in each bite, and what little meat I did get was nothing but marbled with fat and rubbery in texture as if I were gnawing on my car's tires.

Completely inedible.
author: Ty T.

description: I came here with my mom on a recommendation from our hotel. The people here were very friendly, and the food was delicious. Only thing it was too spicy for us. I recommend for people to choose mild if they r not use too spicy foods! Definitely would come back again!
author: David P.

description:
I don't know what it was about this place, but we all ended up so ill. Hunger struck as we were walking around the city, and this place had no wait.. on a Friday night.. should have been a sign!

We ordered a ton of food to share between all of us (~10), and a lot of things were screwed up or missing. There were a few decent dishes in between all the chaos, and the tea was yummy. That's about it...
author: Nic Z.

description: Si Foo Chicken with black bean sauce was excellent as usual.
author: George G.

description:
I got a good tip or what I thought was a good tip from someone that I thought we reliable. Should have just trusted yelp.

First thing I noticed was how slow there were for dinner. The service was nice and quick especially for an Asian establishment.

The food was ok. Flavors were really just salt. They advertised no MSG and just replaced it will tons of salt. 

I should have just gone to House of Nanking like I'd originally planned.
author: Aimee L.

description: Fabulous service and great food. Very carefully explained the gluten free options and made us feel wanted. Food tasted great! Excellent!
author: C.m. H.

description: Very meh. I came for lunch with two others. We were told that the food is very spicy, so the waitress discouraged me from ordering medium. I like spicy food, I just can't handle SUPER spicy stuff, but I took her advice and ordered mild. My friend, who happens to be Chinese and loves very spicy food, ordered hers spicy. Mine came out not spicy AT ALL, and hers was maybe medium...definitely not very spicy. My tofu and broccoli had exactly 3 very small pieces of tofu, and one of them was overcooked. Hot and sour soup was very gelatinous. They gave us some fried stuff along with the lunch special, not of it was very spectacular. Also, I saw ladies rolling dumplings at a table in the dining room. They weren't wearing gloves. Service was friendly, that would be the only plus, and it was pretty inexpensive.
author: Jenny R.

description: I got hair in my food. When I called them to disclose the issue I wasn't given the slightest amount of respect and treated as it was my fault there was hair in my chow mein. I will never order from this restaurant again and if you don't want terrible service and/or subpar food with hair in your chow mein, don't ever go here. Beyond appalled and disgusted.
author: Daniel H.

description:
Good food, good service, decent ambiance. 

We went there mid-afternoon. There were three or four parties there. Service was courteous and pretty fast.

The only negative was that a few items were saltier then the needed to be. 

The Brandy's Dinner was great. Shrimp, beef, and scallops. The scallops were especially delicious -- tender and just right. 

We had Smoked Ham Fried Rice. Saltiness on this was not surprising as it's smoked ham. Flavorful and not greasy as fried rice sometimes is. 

The General Chicken was our third dish. Excellent. Nicely fried and in a sauce that was fruity, not just sweet.
author: Moe R.

description:
My friend and I went to lunch at Brandy Ho's expecting good food. We were sorely disappointed. We ordered their Hot and Sour soup which was okay not the best and not the worst we have had. For our entree we ordered Gon-Pou -Boneless chicken, garlic, bamboo shoots, water chestnuts, & onion topped with peanuts. Our entree was plain no flavor whats-so-ever. During our lunch we heard the manager of the restaurant argue with a customer. The customer tried to diffuse the situation but the manager kept yelling at him for wanting something. 

We left without finishing our food and will never go back.
author: Sharon S.

description:
Ugh!  Too salty!  Too savory!  Not enough sweetness to counter the savory flavor...
The Hot and Sour soup was just...savory and salty.
The Chicken with Curry was too salty and savory, with too much bamboo pieces and not enough bell peppers.
Just not very good...though the servers were friendly enough.
author: Jose G.

description:
Yawn.      Stretch.      Yawn.   

Brandy Ho's is the place you wind up at because you're nearby, it's late, and wait:  is that a parking space?  

There was a time in the past  when it was a great destination spot for large groups but that time passed, as evidenced by the large screen TV tuned to an Italian cooking show.  Now it just feels like a tired relationship that somebody's sleepwalking through.  

Popped in here late one night for a quickie:  

* Spicy eggplant ($8.75) - Good, but kind of johnny-1-note
* General Chicken ($9.50) - Good, but not very much food for almost ten bucks
* White, steamed rice (1.50) - Tired, unloved, and should've been tossed.  

The Ho might still be capable of putting out some rockin' Hunan but lately she has me thinking she's got a little somethin'-somethin' on the sidelines that's getting all her attention.
author: Tracey A.

description: This is my go to place when i crave Chinese food. Service is friendly and food is good. My favorites are Gong pao chicken and sweet and sour pork. I also like their dumplings. Last time I was there, i met the owners, very down-to-earth people.
author: Mark C.

description: Extremely tasty pork fried dumplings- careful when choosing the spice, my friend and I chose medium and had a hard time getting through them.
author: Sarita P.

description: Brandy ho's is absolutely delicious! My friend ordered take out a few weeks back and shared with me. So I ordered a few days later. Same great food both times! I think it is fairly priced food considering how tasty it is. Servings are also very generous. I work across the street so I'll be walking over for more in the future.
author: T A.

description:
This place was pretty good. We had dinner there on a Saturday night. The location is pretty solid from the financial district. The food was above average from the sterotypical shitty asian take out type of places. In my opinion, it didn't knock anything out of the park, but the fried dumplings were absolutely delicious. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive. If you are looking for a quick bite to eat, I'd recommend it. 

Also, cleanliness was okay. It wasn't a five star restaurant, but I didn't have any noticeable health concerns. Staff were also very quick to remove dirty dishes and clean the tables.
author: Trey H.

description: Wow!  This is really flavorful food.  Very fresh and not greasy but very delicious.  Fried dumpling were off the hook!
author: Don W.

description:
This place has never let me down. 
Great flavor
Friendy/ fast service 
Good prices for location
Try the deep fried dumplings with sweet and sour
The hot and sour soup will ruin all other h&s soups for you...forever (it's that good)
**Never had a problem with the food quality**

If you like a lot of flavor with no MSG then you might like this place..

ONLY con I can think of is parking around that area... but am willing  to  find it go get my Brandy Hos!!

BTW I drive about 20-30 min each way EVERY week just to eat here if that helps :)
author: Ronnie M.

description: Brandy Hos was recommended to us by an Uber driver (which is awesome all by itself); it did not disappoint!!! It was awesome!!! 9:00 on a Saturday night the place was great!! Great ambience, great food, and even better service. I highly recommend!
author: Eric B.

description: Have been eating here with family and friends for the last 24 years when traveling from east coast. Family run, same chefs and best chinese food in SF.
author: Peter H.

description: I love this place! Food is fresh and delicious and I can taste that there really is no MSG so it actually tastes like real food, not the cheap stuff you regret later.
author: Lena T.

description: Thank you for being open at 1045pm. We were starving and glad we found this place. The food came out so quickly and was delicious. The wine list and beer selection were nice as well!
author: Julia D.

description:
We came on Christmas Day! What daredevils! We made an online reservation but still wound up waiting about 15 minutes passed that time slot before we got a table - it was way in the back away from the action. Definitely call ahead rather than show up at the door, because it was a hostess' nightmare in the lobby.

The waitress warned us that the food would take normal than longer to come out; we understood. It actually came out really fast, so the warning was for naught.

The food was good - it seemed like run of the mill Chinese food, some things were more flavorful than others. The fried dumplings were good (lots of Yelpers said so, they aren't lying.) We also had calamari, spicy beans, fried rice, beef broccoli, and chicken. Everything went down without a hitch and we were out of there without complaint! That is hard to pull off on a busy Christmas Day dinner rush, but Brandy Ho's succeeded.
author: Halley S.

description: OG China town shit right here. Everything is amazing.
author: Kat M.

description:
I love Brandy Ho's.

I have been eating here on and off since the 90's and the food has always been excellent.

Brandy Ho's Deep Fried Dumplings are the best EVER! 6 big, hot, spicy fried dumplings for only $6.00.

I love sitting at the counter and watching the food being cooked and gorging on dumplings. 

When I moved away from SF for 10 years I would dream about Brandy Ho's Deep Fried Dumplings...thankfully I am back and I don't have to dream anymore.
author: Cat A.

description:
I've tried quite a few chinese restaurants in SF. I won't be coming back here.

I ordered there lemon chicken dish. I was disappointed in that they decided to use old cooked chicken for my dish and just pouring lemon sauce over it as the chef was about to leave and go on break.

It should have been sautéed in the wok but the restaurant was too lazy to sauté the chicken. Old quality food for an expensive price.

Overall for the poor quality food I won't be coming back.
author: Stephen C.

description: Best Chinese food I have ever had! Egg rolls are a must order. I could drink their sweet chili sauce from a straw, it's so good! Highly recommend this place if you want to dine in Chinatown. Very clean and friendly environment, fast service.
author: Brooke A.

description: I ordered Hot & Sour chicken, Hot & sour soup, and Ho's Chow Mein for delivery. The food was tasteless and no one liked it. Ho's Chow Mein was OK but the rest was really worse than expected. I will not order from this place again.
author: Reza F.

description: If a Denny's Diner, Cheesecake Factory and Pei Wei had a kid it would be Brandy Ho's. Hard working staff, decent Asian fusion food and ok prices. Open kitchen and they churn the food out fast. Almost too fast. We asked for our dishes spicy and they did abide, which was refreshing. The deep fried dumplings were by far the highlight. I'd come back for just those. Definitely skip the onion cake unless you like stale air and cardboard.
author: Rahul H.

description:
The best Chinese I've had in years.

We started out with the deep fried dumplings and they are delicious.

My wife had beef chow mein and I had beef and broccoli (spicy). We shared an order of vegetable fried rice. All were tasty and fresh.

Will be coming back soon.
author: James B.

description: The only thing that drew my boyfriend and I into restaurant was the NO MSG sign. It was larger than their restaurant name itself, but for Chinese food to not have MSG, it was something we wanted to try. I had the Brandy Ho's Chow Mein, which was nothing special, but my boyfriend didn't think it was bad. He had the beef stew noodles, which I thought was really bland as well. The beef was nice and soft, but it didn't have much flavor. Also, seeing the reviews from other Yelpers, I ordered the fried dumplings with hot and sour sauce, but also wasn't a fan of it. It was crispy, but the dumpling itself wasn't very flavorful. When I walked in, all the customers were Caucasian, so I knew immediately this place wouldn't be super authentic Chinese food. that targetted the Asians. Don't think I will be back.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Disclaimer: I had to come here for a business dinner.  One that I did not choose obvi.  

The food here was not my jam but it wasn't horrible either. It was just not to MY liking.   The service was good and the waters were refilled promptly.  

We ordered family style - two diff type of fried dumpling appetizers (I liked the sweet and sour one as it had more flavor - the fillings on both were bland by themselves), calamari, green onion pancake with peanut sauce (wth?!?), walnut shrimp, sweet and sour pork, fried rice, chow main, general chicken, and beef and green onion. Nothing really stood out to me though I did like you can indicate spice level. Medium was actually medium and I liked that.  

Like I said this was a business dinner that I didn't choose, I'm glad to say I have tried it but sorry I won't be back.
author: Julie F.

description:
Ho Hum.  We wasted one of our meals out on our SF vacation at this place.  Wah. Wah.

The onion pancake was virtually tasteless and a grease bomb to boot.  We had a spicy chicken dish and they made it pepper flake spicy (yeah, like the pepper flakes you put on pizza) but not tasty.
