Many better places in SF and Chinatown to hit up.  This is westernized food .. not a single Chinese diner when we were there.
author: Willanne W.

description: The plum sauce for the mushu pork was ketchup mixed with soy sauce.  Ack
author: Adrienne D.

description: The hot and sour soup was pretty tasty.  I also enjoyed the sweet and sour deep fried dumplings.  However after enjoying those 2 appetizer items I was excited to try the main dishes.  I had a few lunch menu items, the chicken bites , shrimp fired rice, and some beef dishes.  I was disappointed the food lacked in the flavor.  In general everything just tasted bland.  I would def go back for the dumplings next time and skip the main dishes.
author: Kevin R.

description: Not good. We were told by concierge it was great food. It's not. Might be the worst we've ever had. Upon entry and up the stairs you will notice a stench that is disarming. That should be the only sign you need to turn around and walk away.
author: Angel S.

description:
Things that made me go Mmmmm:
Dumplings
Gon Pao Chicken
Chow Mein
Spicy beef in wine sauce
Sweet and Sour Pork
Prompt and helpful delivery!

Things that made me go Hmmm?: 
Catered for 12 people but no soy sauce or fortune cookies.

Thinks that made me go Eh:
String beans- they're alright
author: Edi B.

description: I do not eat fast food, but I would rather have panda express. This is the most bland chinese food I have ever had. I tried it 2 times bec. i had heard it was good but was extremely disappointed.
author: Benjamin L.

description: Went to college here in the eighties. Now live 2,000 miles away and find myself dreaming of these dishes when I awake early mornings. Just visited and happy to report the place still lives up to my dreams. Not your everyday Chinese. Smoked duck, meat and chicken dishes here are a must. Chicken Salad with an earthy peanut dressing and tender glass noodles.....sooo good! Heat is what the Hunanans do and I love em for it.....but  dishes can be scaled down for the meek. Love. Love. Love this place!
author: Dana D.

description:
Prior to this past weekend, my last visit to Brandy Ho was 1996. Used to be a "go to" place for my family when in SF. Was really good then. 

Sorely disappointed on my recent return. Breaded shrimp were straight out of the freezer, into the deep fryer, and onto my plate with a little sauce drizzled on top. Not even good quality boxed frozen shrimp. 

Brandy Ho Special fried rice was nearly inedible. From the color, texture, and taste of rice, vegetables, and meats, this stuff had been prepared and reheated at least a couple of times.  Should have been thrown out and even alley cats would pass. 

In a nutshell, spent $30+ to be served deep fried breading with some shrimp bits buried inside, and mushy, tasteless thrice cooked fried rice. 

Left this dump and went elsewhere for lunch. 

Adios Brandy Ho. Never again.
author: Steve V.

description:
I have been going to "The Ho" since 1997. I've been ordering delivery from The Ho for the past 5-6 years. Yes, it's not real Chinese food as a lot of people will say. However it is a decent twist on hot and spicy Americanized Chinese food. 

A couple of weeks ago I placed an order for delivery. The order was incorrect. Since the driver had left and I didn't want to wait another 45 minutes I ate what was delivered. I took a picture of the delivered items and emailed it along with with my order receipt -- the two together clearly showing a mistake. Brandy Ho's never even acknowledged my email. 

The restaurant business is an extremely competitive business. In this type of service business it only takes one mistake to lose a long time customer. Brandy Ho's must believe they have enough customers to treat a few here and there poorly. That's OK. However, I will not spend my money there again.
author: GB M.

description:
I've been coming here for literally 30 years. I know the owner, the brothers and most of the staff.
They've had their ups and downs. Not everything has been consistent, I'm sorry to say.
A couple of things that you can't go wrong with:

Hot and Sour Beef... this is the best thing on the menu. If you can't handle spicy and have to order it mild FORGET ABOUT IT! It's not for you.

Kung Pao Shrimp (chicken is good too).. always great...  Make sure only one person at your table is ordering this, as if they cook two batches at once, the shrimp don't get perfectly carmelized and you miss the unique nuance of how great this dish can be.  Or, order the second one after the first has arrived (dirty trick, but it's important!  That carmelized shrimp taste really makes the dish POP!)

Harvest Pork... salty as hell.. but very good

Cold Noodle Salad is a good app to share
author: Josh K.

description:
Generally a good place. I have ordered delivery from here many times but finally ate at the restaurant. The restaurant decor could use some sprucing up and updating.

Most of the time food quality and flavor are very good, but occasionally you can end up with an entree that is bit bland. During my last visit, fried potstickers in sauce were excellent but the Gon-Pou chicken was a  bit bland and had too many onions (lots of onions, very little chicken).
author: ej l.

description: Three stars because the food was good. Would have been five, but they were so rude and the waitress, if you can call her that, hovered as we signed for payment. The moment we put the book back down she opened it and told us the "survey" was not included... we hadn't finished paying and she was demanding her tip. Funny thing is, she wasn't even attentive or kind.
author: Kayla R.

description: I visit Brandy Ho's every time I visit San Francisco. Going on 8 years now. Try the amazingly tasty and fresh dumplings. They are worth the visit alone. And absolutely no MSG served here. Their food is legit. Especially if you love spicy. They can make things mild too, but enjoy the heat if you can take it.
author: Cal R.

description:
I ordered Mild shrimp fried rice. Do not, I repeat, do not order "mild"!!! It comes with TONS of huge red pepper flakes that are just waiting to burn your soft tissues.

Yuck. Bleah. 

Why one star? They came back, brought us new orders of our same food, this time with "no" spice and took our old food away (I assume to re-heat and serve to the next unsuspecting person to order shrimp fried rice from seamless.com).

Ugh. Do not order from this place. Ever.
author: Kelly G.

description:
The restrooms were clean. The waiter was pleasant. That's the end of the positive part of the review.  

The food was bad (understatement). The steamed dumplings were way too doughy and very salty. Our rice was hard on top, and it was cold and inedible. It tasted Ike it had been drying out in the bowl, uncovered, for hours. How could any restaurant, let alone a Chinatown Chinese restaurant, not be able to serve a decent bowl of rice? The broccoli in the broccoli dish was good and hot but everything they mixed it with was just tepid. It was way too salty an tasted like like everything had been precooked and sitting in a fridge somewhere waiting to get  combined with salt and the main (broccoli) ingredient in a pan for a few minutes, and by someone who was either not trained or not conscientious. Lastly, the eggplant literally tasted like nothing. There was no taste. Except for salt. At least it was hot. After a bite each, we decided not to eat it or take it with us. 

We paid and left after 'eating' for about five minutes. At least the waiter took the rice off.  

We wouldn't recommend it at all. Maybe they had an off night but I doubt it.
author: Donal B.

description: We ate dinner here on Christmas Day. The restaurant was very busy but the owner got us a table quite quickly. We ordered Hot & Sour soup and two entrees. The soup came out quickly, but was very mediocre. And our entrees took 30 minutes to come out and weren't very flavorful. The prawns were dry and the beef with onions was soft but also flavorless, and both dishes were listed as "Chef's Specialities". The service was okay. If it were not Christmas Day, we probably wouldn't have gone in and we definitely will not be going again.
author: Alan L.

description:
After viewing yelp reviews we stopped in for a small dinner at Brandy Ho restaurant.  We had the Brandy Ho chow mein.  It was good, fresh, and can't wait to try more dishes.  

Also, the bathrooms were clean.
author: Kisha Y.

description: Spicy Chinese food. Great location. Good service.
author: Coral H.

description: Brandy Ho's is good lunch spot, but nothing to write home about.   Not really a lot else to say.
author: Michael E.

description:
I've been coming here since I was a child. My mom used to bring my brother and I with my (now) step-dad. I love how spicy the food is, the consistently amazing flavor, the speedy service, and those deep-fried dumplings! 

Favorite entrees are the onion cakes, dumplings, shredded pork with celery, Brandy Ho's special, szchechuan chicken, and kung pao chicken. 

We have never had to wait for a table, and we usually don't have a problem finding street parking on the side street riiiiight after you pass the Columbus side of the restaurant.
author: Ashley J.

description:
Like stepping into the twilight zone. "hey this place might be fancy, blcked out windows - let's check it out " enter the dining room it's a cafeteria that was stuck in the 80's. I would be admiring the kitsch more if prices weren't for a "better" restaurant. 
Food is salty and steam table quality but the staff is nice.
author: E K.

description: If you like spicy food.. Hunan is kind of like the cajun cooking of China.. Brandy's makes the best fried dumplings on the planet.. You will wake up in the middle of the night dreaming of their dumplings.. order em spicy.. Unless your a sissy
author: Derek M.

description:
I ordered for delivery.  I got the wanton soup, hot and sour soup, and the fried rice special.  The rice was a little harder than I was used to, almost like they were whole wheat kernels, but they weren't.  The rice was also a bit on the greasier side.  

The soups were pretty good.  The wanton soup in particular was a little lighter, not as much salt.  Which I count as a good thing.  The wanton themselves were good and made in a classical sense.  The filling was decent and I would say better than average coming from delivery.
author: Eric C.

description: Meh... There are so many better options out there, unless you are looking for the lowest common denominator Chinese food restaurant. This place serves the standard Americanized Chinese food that so many love, but is not my favorite...
author: Greg F.

description: Excellent Chinese food was different from what I'm used to there's really no 2 exact Chinese food restaurants the same butt I really enjoyed the athentic taste and fresh ingredients they use would recommend you to try it.
author: Tim R.

description:
I've been back a couple times now, and it wasn't nearly as spicy. I've even ordered extra spicy and I didn't die or hallucinate.

I figure there must have been an accident on my first visit. The food is still spicy, but nowhere near insane. Good!
author: William H.

description: We came to this place after the restaurant we wanted to eat at had too long a wait.  Should definitely have continued looking.  The beef broccoli was terrible - my wife had to send it back and order something else more edible.  Other dishes were simply  lacking in flavor.  One benefit to this place - we were seated right away.
author: Jim O.

description: If it were possible to give no stars I would. If you know what good flavor is don't go to this place. I had high expectations because it was recommended by a friend who lived here in SF but it sucks!everything was either salty or no flavor. The fried rice tasted burnt and smoky and bland at the same time. Don't waste your money. And service sucks, our waitress was wouldn't move a finger til we would say please and she waited for it with a smirk as if we were in grade school. And we all asked for water with lemon and the waitress said she would have to charge us 1$ for lemon....when we got our water it was the smallest piece ever...for a dollar I want the whole lemon!
author: Jackie A.

description: After passing up about 1000 Chinese joints, I remembered my cabbie's recommendation for Brandy Ho's. Great service and good prices. Leslie,  was more of a 5'1" cuisine counselor than waitress. Egg roll appy came out in 2 minutes with original Sauces. Main course was excellent but about 5 notches spicier than I usually like -- or that was ordered -- But it was good and no regrets. Cook needs to be sent back for spice level training but otherwise great. I have to go extinguish my mouth fire now.  Enjoy!
author: Barry N.

description: For over twenty years this place has been a locals favorite and it's a family favorite. Go-to favorite meals are Mi Soo vegetable, Si Foo chicken, eggplant salad, pork fried rice. Packed with flavor. Family owned lovely people. And great prices.
author: Philip F.

description: This place was delicious! I'm currently visiting from out of town and my uncle whom is local brought us here for lunch. The food was fresh and prepared quick. Very clean establishment, friendly servers. All in all a great lunch. If I lived here I would eat here often!
author: Rachel A.

description:
Still coming to Brandy Ho's with the same friend after around 20 years.  We get the same table every time and usually order the same exact thing.  Cold peanut sauce noodles for him, and braised fish for me.  Of course we get the lunch special since we are both little piggies!  Delicious onion cake, hot n sour soup and a little dish of picked veggies - yum.

When I was there earlier this week I was starving and decided to go with my old favorite of Hunan-style smoked ham and vegetables.  Yes, it's a sodium bomb, but it is so delicious it's worth splurging on every now and again.  I told myself that I would only eat half and bring the rest back to work for lunch the next day, but it never happened...

Now that a lot of new media companies have moved into the area, it looks like a whole new generation of people are discovering the delights of Brandy Ho's.  There's room for everyone, so come on in and have a wonderful meal!
author: .Hon H.

description:
OK, it WAS the name.  It's a few doors down from Larry Flynt's Hustler Club, and it's in THAT section of SF just a block off the world famous Broadway home to all the strip clubs and titty bars so when I saw the sign, I just couldn't resist.

Inside, well that's a whole different deal.  Real Chinese food, made by real Chinese people.  It was late for dinner and the dinner crowd had come and gone.  There were a group of employees at the far end of the counter (yes, they have a cool counter overlooking the open kitchen with a bank of woks that they cook meals on) folding wontons.  How cool was that?

Watching my spicy Hunan seafood dinner being created in the foundry furnace wok and seeing the craftsmanship in action was amazing, as was the taste and quality of the meal.  I'll be back and for the real reason next time, the food.
author: Lee P.

description:
Really good Chinese food. I'm so excited I finally found a good chinese restaurant in San Francisco. There are many out there that have good reviews but my experience with them turned out to be most disappointing... This one is quite the opposite. They delivered my take out order within the time frame they gave me on the phone. The food arrived hot and fresh.

Their online menu and ordering system is great, easy to use, has pictures and explanations for each dish. The customer service is good too. I have no complaints whatsoever.

As far as the food goes, everything was delicious and fresh. We ordered 
Hot and Sour Soup, Vegetable Chow Mein, Honey Walnut Prawns, Beef in Black Bean Sauce, Sweet and Sour Chicken. All dishes were very good. Vegetables are crisp-tender, there's a taste of fresh ginger in the sauce, basically, delicious food.
We will definitely order from these guys again.
author: Iryna T.

description: Very disappointed with the food. We live up in the mountains and were craving good Chinese food when we came to the city for a little getaway. Nothing about this place spoke to us. Mediocre food and ambiance. I have no doubt there are many better choices in this city!
author: Mary Ann C.

description: We ate here on a recent visit to San Francisco. We stopped in during the lunch hour and order the fried egg dumplings and General Chicken. The egg dumplings were greasy and in an extremely salty soy type sauce. It was so salty I picked the stuff out of the center of the dumplings and left the rest. My wife would not eat any of it. Next the General Chicken arrived. The broccoli was slightly steamed and placed around the outside of the plate. The chicken was in little round pieces fried with a crisp coating on the outside with a sweet sauce and sesame seeds. It was okay, but nothing I would return to eat a second time. The most bothersome thing was the hood vents over the kitchen stoves which are in plain view did not vent correctly so you had this smelly greasy air floating around the place. We live in Kansas City and I can say with all honesty that the decent Chinese places here blow that place away. On a positive note, the waitress that served us was friendly and attentive. The food was mediocre at best.
author: Don T.

description: Terrible Chinese food... esp for the price. They also completely skimped on the meat.  I should have known when the restaurant was completely empty around dinnertime. Given its location (on the outskirts of Chinatown), I wanted  to give it the benefit of the doubt. Not only was it pricey considering the quality, the food just tasted really sour and salty, and was probably one of the worst Chinese meals I've had since moving to the bay.
author: Diana K.

description: OMG how does place have 3.5 stars?! it is barely a 1. It gets a 1 for its subpar service and the fact that its walls are up. As soon as we walked in my 6th sense told me to leave. But we were freakin' starving and didnt know where else to go. So we sat down n ordered. Everything, and i mean everything from soup to appetizer to entree SUCKED. Me and my 3 friends were starving after a day of walking around the city--and even being super hungry, this "food" tasted like shit. We thought--how bad can this place be?---its a chinese restaurant in Chinatown, cant be any worse than Panda Express, right? WrOnG.
author: Fatima H.

description: Excellent food. Highly recommend. This place will get your Hunan fix this is the place
author: Walter G.

description: I live in North Beach which is next store to China Town. It's been 10 years since I've ordered from Brandy Ho's. I ordered from them last night and it was again, very bad.  I asked if they had salt and pepper prawns and the gentleman who took my order said yes. We received fried breaded shrimp that they buy frozen in a box and put in their fryer. Do not order the fried prawns. Very bad. Then we had broccoli with beef and it was also awful.  No flavor and beef didn't taste good either. The quality of the beef didn't seem very high. Over all they do a good job marketing themselves but there are so many delicious Chinese food in China Town that this place is not one of them.  It will be another 10 years until I order from here again.
author: Romwald C.

description:
Very good Chinese food. Fried dumplings were amazing. Also had the fried rice and spicy beef which was good too. 
Service was good and place was very clean.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Brandy ho's has always been my number one favorite Chinese restaurant in San Francisco.  This time I wAs disappointed. It waS just okay not earth shatteringly fabulous as in the passed.  I was there for lunch.  The heAlth rating was 82.
author: Ang S.

description: 30 years of eating here has convinced me there is not a better place for (Hunan) Chinese in SF!  This is true Hunan style food.  Hot & Spicy is their forte!  Hot and Sour vs. sweet.   The fried dumplings are the best I have ever had.  The smoked ham special on the lunch menu is my go to meal.  Hot and Sour Chicken, cold noodles, noodles with hot pork sauce, just to name a few other favorites.  Many of my friends also consider this the best place in SF and one friend would literally fly in from Germany to eat here (a reason to visit family)!
author: Robert C.

description: Started w/ wonton soup followed by the deep fried dumplings. The sweet & sour pork is amazing accompanied w/ Brandy Ho fried rice. Everything is good here
author: Kenneth S.

description:
Salty.
Greasy.
Overpriced.
Dirty. 
Yuck.
author: Foodie F.

description:
I learnt if you are not Chinese and not accompanied by one, but is going to a Chinese restaurant, order the same food you ordered last time and don't be at all advantageous.  I have been following my motto here for years and been very happy. So I give Brandy Ho's a 5Star for the foods I always order here:
Whole Fish (this dish is...OMG!!)
Sweet and Sour Soup 
Deep Fried Dumplings (Order this...forget about ur fat-free diet)
Gon Pou chicken
And this beef dish they have with green/red peppers 

Oh! and don't Yelp "NO MSG"...That's not the name of the restaurant...although I don't blame you if you get confused passing by the restaurant, given the "NO MSG" sign is more apparent than "Brandy Ho's". So, one extra star for "NO MSG".

I think if you follow my motto too, you will give this place a 4-5Star. I can't guarantee how you would feel if you want to order chicken feet stew or some duck leg dish.
author: Sahar B.

description: Brandy Ho's is a great place to enjoy some fantastic dumplings,,,they make it fresh daily and it is so good, The best deep fried pot stickers,,,!! The seafood combo dish is delicious as well and the food is brought to your table fast and hot.  The employees are on it and friendly.
author: p r.

description:
You get home after a hard day's work and the last thing you want to see is one a restaurant flyer rubber-banded to your door knob.  But then you realize you didn't prepare for tonight's dinner and you might as well order from the place.. heck, the phone number is glaring at you.  

I like to say, everything and every place is worth trying atleast once:  If it's terrible, you paid for the knowledge of never having to eat the food again.

Bean sprout cucumber salad- about a 10:1 ratio with hidden bits of cucumber.  Both were wilted, did not have any crunch to it.  Mix it with their 'unforgettable salad dressing' and you can cover up the vegetables, but there's only so much you can take of floppy bean sprout.  I was trying to be healthy but I got the hint- it was just not meant to be for today.

Smoked duck- After I peeled of the thick and chewey skin and took away the bits of floating bone, I got to a very smokey flavored poor quality duck.  

Wonton Soup- I asked for without added sesame oil, so I'm sure I got a little flavor knocked off ( remember, I'm trying to be healthy? -- I had tartine, bi-rite icecream, dinner party, tony's pizza and kingdom cupcake all within 24 hours).  It was okay, the broth was one dimensional and the dumplings were huge.  I loved the thick skin, I may possibly order this, throw some rice into it and mash it up for the next time I'm sick.  Just maybe.  

The quality is probably something you would expect from a cheap chinese restaurant.  So if you like that, you may give it 3 stars.  But I'd much rather spend a few more bucks and get way better food from R&G
author: Hannah W.

description: Went here after a Giants game. Wasn't bad wasn't great.  That's why I have them rated at 3 stars. Ordered Brandy's dinner and pork fried rice. Had better else where. If you're looking for Chinese food whilst on Broadway you can't go wrong here.
author: Mikeveli777 ..

description: I love Brandy Ho's...just started 30 days ago and this is my third order for delivery. This is authentic Hunan Chinese food versus Panda Express or PF Chang. I loved the time I spent in China and this food gives me great memories of the Chinese quisine. Brandy your doing a mighty fine job. Free delivery that is service to your door!
author: Christopher M.

description: eggplant rocked-beef on anything rocked.Enjoyed the  atmosphere and spices on chicken dishes as well! Classic which is why it's been here a long time and remains. No msg rocks,garlic paste on dishes rocked.Go here!
author: Brian D.

description: Truly enjoyed.  GF Hunan Curry was great.  Hot & Sour Chicken, Beef & string beans, sweet & sit shrimp ... All great !  We'll be back.
author: Jeff R.

description:
Our party of 3 went here on Christmas Day for dinner. The restaurant was in total chaos due to the holiday! 
We did have a 6:30 reservation and we were seated promptly. There were so many servers all running around trying to get food to their customers, and the place was packed! We waited about 20 mins for our server to finally take our drink order and decided to order all of the food at once, including the appetizers,  so we wouldn't have to wait. When I looked at the menu online there are so many choices! But when we got to the restaurant they only had a limited menu for the Holiday, which was quite disappointing! Sure wish the person in which I made my reservation would have mentioned that.
We ordered: 
*Steamed and Fried Dumplings; they are good, but not enough filling, in my opinion, lots of dough. Flavorful dipping sauces.
*Chicken Chow Mein; not too oily, fresh veggies. I did bite into a raw piece of chicken but I think that was due to the fact that the cooks were so overwhelmed with filling orders! 
*Gon-Pou Chicken; I got this mild and it was seasoned just right!
Brandy's Dinner; fresh, flavorful, would get this again.

All in all it was a good experience for our first time here. I would not come on a holiday again, however.
author: R. B.

description: my yelp review will be exactly like this restaurant: quick and bland. Wouldn't come back.
author: Blake S.

description:
Went here on Christmas. Big mistake. They had scaled down their menu to about 12
Items. A very boring selection indeed. The only thing that was really good was the hot and sour soup. Everything else
was bland and boring. Service was awful. After our starters we waited 20 min for the rest of the food. Won't be back.
author: R. P.

description:
I'm years behind everyone else!
Ordered my first delivery ever, last night; "Old Country Vegetables with Broccoli."
Delicious!
Cannot wait to try other dishes of vegetables.
author: Corinne d.

description: I have tried several Chinese delivery restaurants in the area and so far this is my favorite.   All of the entrees are always fresh and flavorful and the food arrives still warm and not soggy or cold.  The egg rolls are not my favorite as they are usually overcooked and too crunchy.  Otherwise, if you are looking for good take-out, this is a great choice.
author: Greg B.

description: Food was good, but not something to write home about. the service was awful. Our sever must have had some PMs issue because she was a real witch w a b. If you can find a better place, def do.
author: Ashley M.

description: Excellent spot for legitimate Hunan specialties, right in North Beach. There are so many excellent items on menu, it's a challenge to choose. I have been coming here for 10 years, and I have never been disappointed. The prep work is what makes a great chinese restaurant, and these people have it down. If you can, sit at the bar and watch them cook at the big woks with the flame thrower burners - well worth the visit.
author: Dave D.

description: In a city where the quality of services and goods keeps dropping, Brandy Hos has never disappointed.  Tonight for example...I ordered my usual and they told me it would take 45 minutes to an hour for delivery. 18 MINUTES later my food shows up. That delivery driver was like the asian Winston Wolf. Food was delicious, service was outstanding. And it's like that EVERYTIME, all the time.
author: Michael G.

description: The service is very fast. We ordered both spicy and non/spicy foods they are all good
author: Tracy D.

description:
I LOVE Brandy Ho's North Beach Location. The Castro doesn't quite have the same vibrancy. 

My usual order. Pot stickers, Sauteed bok choy and Kung Pao Chicken. Perfection. 

Please don't ever close!
author: Jeff T.

description:
Brandy Ho's provides one of the best lunch time values for those in search of very good chinese food, Hunan cuisine in particular.

For $8 a person you get wontons to snack on, a three course appetizer, white rice and your choice of entree.  

On this visit we tried the gon pou chicken (or "Kung Pao") and the spicy beef.  The beef could have been more tender, however the chicken was absolutely delicious.

I just wish the whole meal wasn't so damn greasy.
author: Rico O.

description:
OK, what makes this restaurant our family's go-to Chinese restaurant?  First, the wait staff is fast and efficient.  Second, the food always arrives piping hot.  Third, the food can be modified for those with spicy tastes (pretty darn hot for most) or not spicy at all.  Fourth, the food is always tasty and cooked as ordered.  Fifth, the prices are reasonable and the serving size is plentiful.  Be prepared to bring food home.

Our family has been coming here for over 10 years and we're always treated courteously and never have to wait--no matter how busy the place is.  Particular favorites are any of the Gon-Pou dishes, Hot and Sour Beef, Honey Walnut Prawns, Sweet and Sour Pork, and even the vegetable dishes are excellent!  We also enjoy the Dumplings and Egg Rolls and of course no meal is complete without Brandy Ho's Chow Mein AND Fried Rice.  Yum-yum...

If you go on Saturday nights when North Beach is really buzzing, these folks have the 'A' team cranking out food whilst the owner (in suit and tie) is busy running a tight ship ensuring the food gets out and the customers are happy.  This is a busy and thriving Chinese restaurant on one of the most hotly competitive strips of food estate in San Francisco (walk down Columbus Avenue and see how many restaurants beckon you to eat at their place) They don't beckon at Brandy Ho's and as far as I'm concerned, it's obvious why.

In over 10 years and probably 50+ visits here (lunch and dinner), we've enjoyed great consistency in terms of service and food quality.  Bottom line, check this place out and see for yourself.

Jack, keep up the good work.  Your team rocks!!!
author: Duane J.

description:
I am sorry that the Brandy Ho's location in Castro has closed a few months ago.
Does anyone know where the staff all ended up?  I went to Brandy Ho's downtown
and did not see anyone...Alan, Ivan, and the nice ladies from the kitchen.
author: Mitch L.

description:
I've been coming here since I was seven years old. I am now in my twenties and let's just say.. The food is AMAZING! My family and I come here all the time, delivery, all forms ;) some favorites are the fried wontons, onion pancake, steamed dumplings (yes, it may sound healthy but the flavor packs a punch! The dough is made to perfection) last but not least, you absolutely HAVE TO order the smoked ham hot and spicy over rice. Whenever I come in, I order two. All to myself! ;)
They also can adjust spice level for those with a more sensitive tummy. Happy eating!
author: Daisy B.

description:
I've got a secret. There's a place near my office I can go when I want something hot, spicy, and really beefy. For 13 years I've been sneaking over to Brandi Ho's at lunch time to get one of my favorite comfort foods, the stewed beef chunks noodles. Without fail, I am always reminded that it is served in a bowl with broth like a soup, and every time I am warned not to order it too spicy. I have never been disappointed. The broth is super beefy to match the rich and dark brown chunks of beef mixed with cabbage and thick noodles.  It is simple yet complex with the crushed red pepper seasoning and I always leave satisfied. The price is also impossible to beat. 
Please don't tell anyone, though. It's a secret.
author: David W.

description: After walking by Brandy Ho for over 30 years, I finally went in. I recently developed a sensitivity to MSG and didn't want to totally cut out Chinese food.  I was pleasantly surprised. After having MSG at Chinese restaurants all these years, this was definitely different, but still good. I tried some familiar dishes and they were still good. This is an adjustment but at least there is a good alternative. Thank you Jack Ho, the charismatic owner, for all your help. We will be back.
author: Tommy L.

description:
OMG, SOOO Good the best I have ever had!! I got the Seafood trio SPICY!! 
Service was good. 
Clean atmosphere.
author: Sunny P.

description:
i guess *no msg* means no flavor?

purchased :: hot + sour soup (to go)
lacked :: anything hot or sour

service :: not friendly staff, didn't ask if i wanted a cup or bowl.  she gave me a cup, but charged me what seemed to be a bowl price!
author: Tina F.

description: Good management n best of all, great food. I love to eat out n when you find a restaurant that has great food with good service, I had to Yelp! I will recommend this restaurant to all my family n friends.
author: Boss D.

description: Brandy Ho's is my favorite Chinese restaurant in San Francisco or anywhere for that matter. I've been going there for over 25 years and the food is always outstanding. The portions are great, the ingredients they use are high quality and the service is fantastic. I highly recommend the deep fried dumplings, the beef with green onions and wine sauce along with the sifu chicken (all white meat). The flavors their dishes generate are so good, I almost don't want to dilute them with anything I drink.I can honestly say that I've always had a thoroughly enjoyable dining experience each time I've come here. Good stuff!
author: Keith W.

description:
Bought a voucher for this place for $50 worth of food.

For whatever reason, unknown to me, the voucher was only good Monday through Thursday.

Why a restaruant would put such a restriction on such a large voucher is beyond me. 

Of course, this limitation was brought to light after I invited several friends out to dinner "on me." I ended up paying $65 out of pocket (which was, out of pocket!) since it was Saturday.

To make matters worse, I was still freaking hungry when I got home and ate a bunch more food.

Total bs.
author: Maple S.

description: A San Francisco institution. Great Hunan food. A close second to Henry's Hunan. Good appetizer menu. Reasonable prices.
author: Orlando S.

description: The food was OK but we ordered the "Trio of Seafood Appetizer" which states an order of two minimum. The price listed was 7.00 so we knew it would be 14.00 for the 2. But when it arrived there was a small single serving size of fried calamari, 3 oysters, and 3 shrimp. We called them to say 1 was missing, but they said they combined it. So I asked is a single order 1 and a half shrimp and 1 and a half oysters? The lady got annoyed and said we don't do single orders! I asked why don't they just charge 14.00 and forget the whole deception because it obviously is. It's a shame because the food was OK they just need to make a change to the menu and stop deceiving people.
author: Sf T.

description:
Really, really great delivery. Everything was super fresh... egg rolls were crispy... and we live a decent hike away. 

Any place that asks me if I want something spicy makes me happy, because I love spicy. I've never been asked how spicy I wanted my egg rolls. And that pretty much made my very long day.

They rock, and I love them.
author: Lindsay S.

description:
Bf and I was craving for some good Chinese food in the middle of the night..  I think it was around 9pm. The good chinese restaurant nearby is already closed so we resorted to going to Chinatown, hopeful that there's still some good spots that are still open. 

We had a couple of choices to go to but we went to this one because they were showing college football :) Me and bf are both football fans.

We started off with the sweet & sour deep fried dumplings which was really really really tasty. I'm a fan of sweet and sour dishes and I really really liked this one. The deep fried texture of the dumpling really went well with the sauce.

Then I ordered the usual chicken chow mien. I always order this each time I eat in Chinese restaurants but I am confident to say that they have the best in town that I've ever tasted! Bf ordered the spicy beef with some vegetables. It was really spicy I drank 5 glasses of water the entire time we sat there at the resto!

We finished our meals with the coconut dessert ice cream. It was a bomb :)

total spent =around $50ish~
Overall experience =5 stars :)
author: Catrina L.

description: I'm not too picky about food but the food here is terrible. The dishes were blant and barely got any flavor. Dissapointed.
author: Nhat L.

description: Quite bad. Even worse than Americanized Chinese food. Onion cake - supermarket frozen food and over fried. Shifu chicken - salty and spicy but no flavor at all. I cannot see their passion on food.
author: Vicky S.

description: Customer service was mehh, food was very mehh, I got the eggplant dish and this guy got some curry seafood dish, it's hard to mess up a curry seafood dish, don't know how they do it. Very salty and dry for everything. No MSG, but still salty.
author: May G.

description: Brandy's dinner was delicious, a mixture of beef and shrimp.   I added chicken fried rice.  Enjoyed very much.   All ingredients tasted fresh.
author: AJ M.

description: The service was good. The dumplings and chow mein were good.  The price was good.  But and a big BUT, I found it disconcerting to watch the cooks eating bits of the filling with their bare fingers as they were preparing and forming the dumplings.  It did affect my after meal perception.  Can we say gross!!
author: Shawn M.

description:
I've been there only once, I was with a friend we're was talking just in front of Brandy Ho's and we start to feel the hunger and we walked in Brandy Ho's, we really liked the food very much.

Fine dishes, I really enjoy my food this night, the waitress was very nice and caring with us. 
We had a good time at Brandy Ho's, I will back to this place surely.
author: David Z.

description: Super bland Chinese food. There was nothing Asian Fusion about the dumplings, chow mein, eggplant, or egg rolls. All of the food was overly salty as well. We would not order from Brandy Ho again. Thumbs down. Yuck.
author: Louise A.

description: "NO MSG" I really hope the advertisement was accurate. This place was clean and service was attentive. We ordered the Brandy Ho's house chowmein and the beef stew noodles. I was satisfied with my beef stew, but I can understand why some people consider it to be bland. The beef was surprisingly soft and tender. I probably wouldn't order the chowmein again, since it lacked flavor. Also, parking in this area is almost nonexistent, unless you are super lucky.
author: Jack S.

description: This is my favorite chinese restaurant of all time, and I went to Wo Hop in NYC! The service, ambiance, location, prices, and of course, the food were all beyond a five star rating. When I was here with my family in July, I ordered the beef with bean cake. The natural umami flavor (that monosodium glutamate tries to replicate) hit my tongue like an IMAX surround sound system. To know that unlike a decent amount of places I know, they don't use MSG (and they even boast the fact), made me only love this place even more. I went over to Yuet Lee (a highly recommended SF Chinese restaurant), asked if they used the stuff, they answered yes (in the sauces to be exact), my family and I left. It's amazing how authentic Chinese food can taste good without MSG, but it's sad that Yuet Lee was lazy enough to use it. I loathe the very existence of Monosodium Glutamate! But whether that thing exists or not, I'm astonished that this underrated restaurant represents the Chinese culture of San Francisco in, for lack of a better word, such a tasty way. San Francisco is my favorite city of all time, and as mentioned, this is my favorite Chinese restaurant of all time.
author: Mike W.

description:
Second review flamed by a single experience. The positive reviews are a travesty. These raters are not with us, they are therefore with the terrorists. C'mon- 3.5 stars, seriously? Some of these raters would award a constellation of stars to a piece of turd. But nuff about them, the real culprit is the ho herself- Brandy!  This food is designed from a wet dream of a white cook from 1950 about chinese food. Then the recipes are castrated twice over, laundered and implemented by a blindfolded brandy. Disgustingly, she has not changed a thing in eons, having spent her best inspiration- thank the lord. We beg the city to shut this black sink hole of cuisine and replace with panda expresses. As for you star dumping raters - People, stop
pimpin dis whore!!
author: anurag p.

description: Love this restaurant but they have a $50. Delivery minimum. Totally ridiculous. They need to agree to delivery.
author: Cathy Y.

description:
I have been going to Brandy Ho's for so long it is embarrassing.  I now live in Boston (I really miss Brandy Ho's) but I make a point of going every time I am in San Francisco.  I was there last week and it was yummy and spicy!!

I can recommend:

black bean sauce chicken
hot and sour chicken
beef with scallions
hunan ham with garlic (don't miss this one)
pancakes with green onions - my favorite version in the world
eggplant with noodles

Can't beat the prices.
author: Pamela T.

description: I've been coming here for ages and still like the place. Definitely not your usual Chinese joint, and I like it. Their smoked Hunan ham is really tasty. Many other Hunan specialties, good to experiment and try new things here. Service not super friendly but certainly efficient, no complaints on that score. Prices are maybe a bit high and the room shows signs of age, but I like their cooking and will continue to eat here.
author: David K.

description:
Not the best ive had, but one of the freshest chinese food.  Everything was spicy and fresh. Wonderful food and I cant wait to order again.

Fyi, the people that rate this place low because the food had pepper flakes are stupid.  It is HUNAN food. It will be spicy regardless.  order something else if you dont like spices.
author: Shawn A.

description:
This place is not just the epitome of awful Chinese, but awful American Chinese. I can only begin to describe my feelings as me and three of my Chinese friends were brought our meal. Embarrassment for choosing such a terrible place is about as far as I'd like to go.

The plates are big! The portions are miniscule! Everything tastes like salt and all the sauces seem like they're pure corn syrup! The prices are ridiculous for the quality and quantities. We ordered rice for four but there was just enough for three.

The sweet and sour soup was so salty that I lost my appetite at it. Next came the General Tzo's (if you're eating American Chinese, might as well go all the way with it) and each of us got two pieces. The broccoli that came with it was undercooked. Next was the curry shrimp and the harvest vegetables. They were the exact same ingredients except one had shrimp and the other had tofu! I couldn't believe it! Not to mention it tasted like some kind of Thai dish.

This place was a massive disappointment. I can't believe its ratings are so high. You'd have to be nuts to consider this place if you were looking for real Chinese food.
author: Sterling D.

description:
I came here with friends when the line for House of Nanking was too long - but this place is just as good, and great for vegetarians as well.

The steamed vegetarian dumplings were great, solid & filling for an appetizer.  

*  The Bean Curd with Curry is AMAZING, it's spicy and tastes a lot like Indian food - the tofu absorbs the spicy curry flavor very well. 
*  Sauteed Deluxe Vegetables are a standard stir fry.

Spicy Eggplant is decent, not too greasy, but I recommend the above 2 dishes.  

The dishes don't come with rice, so make sure you order rice separately.
author: Bee M.

description: Orders are getting messed up because of new employees. All they say is I did not charge you for that. We should have had the bratwurst on the grill. Also not much pork in mushoo pork.  I have been told never again. Sorry. Peace out!
author: Tom O.

description:
We had an 8:00 rezi here the night of the Chinese New Year parade.  It was extremely crowded and I don't think they even knew we had a reservation, but we got seated within about 15 min.  The food is fab!

We got:
Steamed potstickers
Generals chicken
Fried wontons w/ shrimp
Pork chowmein
Brandys delight dinner

Everything was delicious, albeit the portions could be larger.  Add 2 large hot sakes, 4 bears and a hot tea; the total was $96 w/ tip.  Not bad!  The service was exellent.  They'll turnover tables quickly, if that's what you want, or slow it down if you're looking to hang a while.  We were in and out in 40 min.  

We left happy and not too full for North Beach barhopping.

I will definitely be back.
author: Jennifer T.

description: General chicken is very good quality and interesting, tasty, won ton soup also very very good, beef with black bean sauce was spicy but not too much taste... Disappointing. Service was quick and very friendly. I probably just didn't find a dish that it loved yet. Looks promising.
author: Serge U.

description:
Four stars for the cold chicken salad with sesame peanut sauce and the smoked ham.  One more star for always being consistent and never taking these items off the menu.  So good but super spicy so be prepared.

They are also open pretty late at night which is always a bonus.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
The restaurant is upscale decorated and the place is clean, including the bathroom.
We had beef with green onion, vege eggplant dish , and brown rice. You can order the level of spiciness that you like. The entrees were all spicily delicious. Service was excellent. 
Pricing is even better. The beef dish was only $10.95. The whole bill was $26 for fine dining in San Francisco China Town. BTW, it is an Open Kitchen which means that you can see them cook. Many Asain Restaurant kitchens are not clean and this one is forced to be clean because customers can see the kitchen. You may challenge why I said it is fine dining. It is because the china are upscale ceramic. The waiters are professional. The chef are in uniform and they wear hat-gears for cleaningness. Fine dining for an unbelievably reasonable price.
The Hunan flavor they advertised is very yummy,
We will definitely re-visit when we are in town.
author: ken H.

description:
We visited twice. The ginger steamed fish is limited to the catch that day, so order it first. That dish was my favorite, but the second time we came we were too late to get one. I also had a curry dish and Moi Shu Pork. All good food. 
This is not a date night restaurant. The seating is tight, the clientele casual, the dining area used everyday is table and chairs on linoleum. Serviceable, not elegant.
author: Laura R.

description: Very good food, great service and a very nice dining experience. Jack Ho is a great guy!
author: Michael S.

description:
If you've read my review for the Brandy Ho's location in the Castro, it's basically the same as this one.  The only difference is that I've actually eaten in the restaurant on Columbus.  The dining area seems a little more laid back and casual than the 18th St. location.  Service is still wonderful and attentive.  Brandy Ho's is my favorite, most comforting, most preferred place for Chinese food.  Our go to menu items are:

General Chicken - a little spicy, tender chicken, perfectly saucy.
Honey Walnut Prawns - amazing.  Enough said.
Sweet and Sour Pork - a classic - not overly greasy or saucy, just perfectly fried with large juicy chunks of pineapple.
Brandy Ho's Chow Mein - chicken, pork, and shrimp?  Yes please.
Old Country Vegetables with Broccoli - great veggie dish to balance out all the meats.

The food is consistently yummy, and an added bonus - they deliver!  My only complaint - it's fairly expensive.  But they are the only Chinese place in SF that I have confidence in them actually not using MSG (as advertised) and everything is always fresh, so I'll pay the price.  Highly recommended!
author: Jenna C.

description:
Solid one star. I'm not even sure if this place deserves that considering our terrible experience here. I came in with my family while visiting San Francisco. We sat down, were handed menus, the waitress took a while to come over to take our orders. When she did, we asked her about a noodle dish that was on the menu and she didn't know how to describe them. Aren't you supposed to know your menu? Especially if it isn't that big to begin with?

We ordered soups for each person, an appetizer of steamed dumplings, fried rice, seafood pan fried noodles and general's chicken. The first soup, an egg drop soup, was brought out 20 mins after we ordered. The next soups were won ton soups, brought out about 20 minutes after that. The menu made no mention that the wontons were stuffed with shrimp, which I don't eat. Would have been nice to know in advance, especially those that are allergic and assume they are stuffed with pork. 

The entrees? Oh, those came out in awkward intervals as well. The entrees were okay, but the REALLY crappy service and the fact that we were there for over an hour and a half (maybe even closer to 2 hours) seriously pissed everyone off. There were so many other tables coming in after us and leaving way before us. What is their problem here?

Also, don't go for the ambiance. The tables are placed way too close together and the place is loud. Not loud because of the customers, but loud because the cooks were screaming and yelling the whole time. I walked out of there feeling nauseated with a serious headache.

PS-- there is a $1 upcharge if you'd like white meat only on chicken dishes. That's just disgusting.

I absolutely do not recommend.
author: M B.

description: I ordered their lunch special which now days it's hard to find a deal that comes with soup, and sides. It was a good deal for the price. Their cold noodles were like pasta with peanut butter but the beef with garlic sauce dish that was my main was great. Overall it's a good deal for what you're paying for. They were also extremely fast!
author: Carey T.

description:
Growing up in the neighborhood, I remember the history of the first Hunan restaurant in Chinatown.  Brandy used to cook at the original Hunan Restaurant on Kearny which was located at the current location of House of Nanking.  The owner of this restaurant was none other than Henry Chung of the now famed Henry's Hunan (http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2004/05/02/BUGOE6DU8T1.DTL&ao=2), who expanded to multiple locations throughout downtown and Fidi.  Brandy decided to stay in the area and opened this restaurant in the early 1980's.  Known for their noodle dishes (Tan Tan and Jia Jiang Noodles) back then, it was one of the few restaurants that offered northern Chinese cuisine.  Hunan food became popular because of the spicy kick, which often became a challenge of "how hot can you take?"  Brandy decided to concentrate on the smoked meats (duck and pork) and kept his noodle menu too.  My family dined here when they first opened over twenty years ago, so forgive me for not remembering that meal.  
Recently, a local friend who never tried this restaurant suggested having lunch here.  We both ordered the Harvest Pork with Hearty Vegetables (medium spicy) as part of their $8.95 lunch special; at other restaurants, this dish is called Twice Cooked Pork.  This lunch included a small bowl of Hot and Sour Soup, a small bowl of cold noodles with peanut sauce and julienned cucumbers, and a warm puffy pastry, flavored like green onion pancake as an appetizer; the portions are generous for this price.  
Prior to ordering, the waitress ask for our degrees of spiciness (mild, medium, or hot).  We were given a large community bowl of white rice and two individual plates of the pork dish, comprising of thinly sliced pork pieces, green onion stalks, cabbage, and Szechuan peppercorns.  The pork had a leftover flavor, but the veggies and flavors were otherwise not bad.  The dining room was about half full on a weekday afternoon with our table being the only Asians.  This initially made me apprehensive, but glad that the food was okay.  Will come back to try their noodle dishes and other smoked dishes.  Good value for the dollar.
author: Mike C.

description:
I'm pleading temporary insanity, that's the only logical reason why I actually had dinner at Brandy Ho?!?  I wanted potstickers and maybe some hot and sour soup and somehow we ended up here...I'm so confused.  

I was hesitant but hubby said let's give it a try, can't be that bad since they've been around forever...well, there are plenty tourists and I think they keep this place alive.  Have I become an unsuspecting tourist who doesn't know better and wander into the first Chinese place around North Beach/Chinatown?!?  I'm now beyond embarrassed...truly.

First of all, there is NO potstickers!  WHAT?!?  We should have walked then...  The waitress insisted they had it then pointed at the fried dumpling on the menu and said "fried dumpling is potsticker".  Excuse me?  Fried dumpling is NOT potsticker and don't you even try to sell me that BS.  By now, I'm beyond upset to even think straight but I know my husband better and know that he won't get up and leave so we are stuck having dinner there.

I just wanted to order the minimum, eat and run.  Decided on:
string bean with lamb - $12.95 - we asked for extra spicy.  waiter says "hot here is very spicy, there are 3 levels - mild, medium and hot - what do you want?"  We both said again, extra spicy and he again told us it's very spicy.  This went on back and forth and I finally just have to put my foot down and told him we can handle it.  Of course, it was NOT spicy when we got it and I ended up using half jar of the hot sauce on the table.

harvest pork with hearty vegetables - $8.95 - this is better known as "twice cooked pork".  it's sliced pork with plenty cabbage in a spicy bean paste like sauce.  normally, the pork has a bit of fat but not here.  we ordered extra spicy and of course it wasn't.  the pork was super lean and dry.  

The busboy was clearing our table while my husband was still eating.  He basically picked up everything from our table except the bowl and chopsticks my husband was holding.  Never once asked if we were done or if it was ok.

For the price, the portion was small and quality ok at best.  Given all the restaurants within close proximity, there's no reason to eat here.  Now if I can just erase this shameful evening for good.
author: Gloria H.

description: After a long day touring San Francisco with some relatives on their first trip to CA, we were looking for an authentic Chinese food restaurant to eat at in Chinatown. It was about 8 PM, & the restaurant we initially wanted to go to had a 45 min. wait, so we decided to walk around while we waited for the phone call from them telling us our table was ready. We stumbled upon Brandy Ho's, & are so glad we did. It wasn't packed, so we were seated right away (party of 7). We are big fans of spicy food, & asked that all the food we ordered be made extra spicy. They delivered! The food was OUTSTANDING. You can tell they don't use MSG (as they are very proud to display on their wall), the food tasted a lot better than some other Chinese food places I've been to. The food is cooked right out in the open, rather than in the back in an enclosed kitchen. So you can see the chefs & the food as it's being prepared. It also comes out piping hot, fresh off the flame! My sister, who is NOT a Chinese food fan, (she had been protesting from the moment we decided that we were eating Chinese), loved it so much that she asked for another order for chicken fried rice for the table. The service was great, our waiter was SO friendly, & chatted with my relatives about where they're from, how they liked SF, the weather, etc. We had a very shy 9-year-old with us, too, & our waiter was sure to talk to him & get him to open up a little. My grandmother, who is maybe a little eccentric, lol, was a fan of the plastic chopsticks on the table. She liked them so much that she wanted to take them home. We tried to tell her that it wasn't appropriate, but since she was so adamant, we decided to ask our waiter how much money they would take to let us keep the chopsticks from our table. He was told us to take them at no charge & even joked with my grandmother about hiding them in her purse. He totally didn't have to do that, but he was very nice about it. Overall, we had a great experience & I would say that if I was ever in SF again & wanted some authentic Chinese food, I would stop here for another taste!
author: Radheka S.

description: Excellent Hunan food. Never disappointed here. Friendly staff and the service is always fast and efficient.
author: Richard P.

description: Love Brandy Ho's! Every time I'm in the city with family or friends Brandy is a go to. My favorite dishes are the dumplings and all of the chicken dishes that I've had. Authentic and great service, definitely worth stopping in.
author: Patty M.

description:
Not sure what's up with all the bad reviews, but this has been my staple for chinese (eat-in and delivery) for the last decade.  Hot and Sour soup is absolutely amazing.  All the great chinese without that starchy and oily taste.  

Will eat here as long as I live in this city!
author: Brian G.

description:
I have never had a bad experience at Brandy Ho's.  I work a couple blocks over and their delievery system is great.  Its quick.  The food always comes still hot.

It's well priced and the food is worth it.  I wouldn't go driving across town for this place but i will say that if you are close enough to get there and are in the mood for Chinese food... It's an easy place to choose.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Brandy Ho's is a good delivery option for the Financial District, North Beach, Russian Hill areas...well, the Eastside in general. And they now have a Castro location for the Westies.

I still prefer Henry's Hunan, but they don't deliver. 

Some favorites are the Pork Meat Sauce and Vegetable Noodles (the vegetable is cabbage), the ultimate white man's Chinese dish Honey Walnut Prawns (not as tasty and gooey as the version served up at Ha's, but Ha's is dead and gone) and any of the vegetable dishes.

I keep forgetting to ask them if they'll put my food in ye olde fashioned cardboard containers, they use plastic and hot food combined with plastic is probably not healthy for children and other living things. (and no, I don't believe that Sheryl Crow got breast cancer from drinking out of water bottles that got hot when she left them in her car, but think about what goes into making plastic, yuk)
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
If you look hard enough you'll find one or two items that do not contain the word "fry" in the description. I had to read the menu three times to find them. Settled on the Old Country Shrimp.

Not nearly as bad I was expecting. Quite a few shrimp, bamboo, bell peppers and onions in a black bean sauce. Oil was there, but not in the excessive quantities that I had feared.

Space is super modern. Almost too much so for the neighborhood.

They earn three stars for the food, but the high price ($13 after tax) brings them down to two.
author: Jason B.

description: Tried their appetizers trio which had fried calamari, fried oysters and fried shrimp. Also tried their fried dumplings. The dumplings with the sweet and sour sauce was quite tasty. However, the fried calamari was horrible, very salty and they use a lower quality squid so it was tough. For a chinese restaurant it seemed pretty clean. Probably wouldnt go back, but thats only based on appetizers.
author: Thao T.

description: Terrible food.  Some friends went to pick up some food at our favorite Chinese place in the area but it was unexpectedly closed.  I remembered eating here years ago and liking the food.  I called to see if they had a lunch menu, they said they did but not online.  I told him I would want kung pao chicken with white meat, he told me it was $7.95 plus $1 extra for white meat. My friends came back with the food and a check for $13.54.  They were told there was no lunch special, only a la carte.  The food was awful.  It was swimming in grease and loaded with bamboo shoots and onions.  I hate bamboo shoots, who puts bamboo shoots in Kung Pao chicken?  There were maybe 5 peanuts and maybe 2 ounces of chicken.  I even called to complain, the woman who answered was of no help.  The frozen Chinese food at Safeway is better then this. Seriously.
author: Stephanie G.

description: The service sucked! The food was even worse. We knew we had a problem when we ordered jasmine tea and the waitress brought us some sort of black tea. And when we asked another other waitress she said they don't have jasmine tea. Then our waitress back peddled calling it a jasmine black fusion. Sigh. Anyone who has ever had jasmine tea knows jasmine tea! The chicken was tough, the beef had no flavor. Needless to say, we paid for the appetizer and left.
author: peres o.

description:
I saw this once in a book listing the best 100 Chinese restaurants in America. They must not have tried Eric's in Noe Valley.

Their lunch deal is a pretty good price (around $6). However, their food's not worth going out of your way for. Hence when I worked in downtown SF, I only went here twice since it was something like 7 blocks away.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Very good value for what you get, and tasty too.

I got the lunch special for $7.95, and got an appetizer of hot and sour soup, a pancake, and small noodle salad, which were all good.  The entree of braised fish was also good.  Although I think the fish was a little overdone, and there were too many onions for my liking.  But overall I was happy with the food and service.  The place is clean with lots of seating.
author: hag a.

description: This place is awesome!  The Zagat awards pretty much sum it up that this place has the best Hunan food around.  Our favorite is the fried dumplings!  Be warned, however, that this place means SPICY when they say spicy!  Service is fast and food is excellent!  For those of you with families that don't know the area, this is located in north beach near all of the strip clubs and adult shops FYI.
author: Phil D.

description: Wonderful find while in SF. Was recommended by a local when in town with colleagues and we couldn't have been more pleased. Friendly staff, great service and the food was awesome. If you're ever in the mood for good Chinese, go to Brandy Ho's!
author: Claudia C.

description:
Ugh! Nasty Americanized Hunan food! I should have known, because I got the recommendation from a Frommer's Guide! Never again.

They sat me at the counter since I was dining solo and the owner was friendly, helping me to order, but I just didn't like the taste of anything, especially the house smoked ham with bamboo, carrots, and bell pepper, which he recommended. The food wasn't spicy and everything had an odd sour taste to it. It wasn't sour like normal Hunan food.

And the onion cakes are served with peanut sauce! What? Chinese people don't put peanut sauce on their onion cakes! Yuck!
author: Olivia D.

description:
CLEAN TRUSTWORTHY Chinese food!  Yay!  

A great alternative to that nasty House of Nanking!
author: Sasha B.

description:
1 "ONO" out of 5 - Not So Ono-licious
Can't beat the lunch plate prices.  I have been wanting to go there for a long time.  Surprised how dirty it was overall.  WARNING - don't look up!
author: John A.

description: The delivery was a little slow, but the delivery guy was nice. The chicken tasted frozen (kind of like reheated chicken in a microwave), and the Honey Walnut Shrimp was extremely disappointing. Don't think we'll come back.
author: Trish D.

description:
"When a Chinese restaurant asks if you want to upgrade the meat, you always say yes."

- My ex
The man got a lot of things wrong, but he really nailed this.
author: Kelly C.

description: The deep fried dumplings are the best!  My mom loves the onion cakes.  I love the garlic chicken.   There's Chinese ladies making handmade dumplings in the back.  Hot and sour soup, everything is delicious here.  When I go to SF this is a must!
author: Karen M.

description:
Touristy place with lots of Liz Claiborne types and feathered hair. The food looked/smelled so bad from the doorway, I refused to go in...think Safeway brand of ready made Chinese food in Sacramento. 

Ugh.

Deplorable indeed.
author: Miika M.

description: Great food and great service with very good price. I paid only $7 and I got an small bawl of soup, big dish of smoked ham and vegetables and fried rice plus a welcome tea in a cold rainy day. :) I strongly recommend this place
author: Siavash F.

description:
Dont eat here unless you want hair in your food. I am disgusted!!!

I ordered food for my office and in my lunch box there was a huge piece of black hair. I called got a refund, but not before they took  the food back. In exchange they asked if i wanted something for free. I asked for Honey Walnut Prawns, when i received the free prawns there was a small black hair on the shrimp. I dont think this place has ever heard of hair nets.
author: Irina M.

description: If your in the mood for hot-n-spicy Chinese food this is the place for you. All their dishes are very tasty and the spice level is your choice, but the prices and last years health rating (vermin infestation) prevent me from giving this place a higher rating.
author: Larry K.

description:
Hot and sour chicken
- Tiny pieces of chicken
- Too much onion

Unsatisfying for the price.
author: Rodrigo T.

description: I had it delivered to my room. Delivery was fast. The food was just okay. I will skip it on my next trip to San Francisco.
author: Susan M.

description: Looking for a quick bite to eat after 9p on a Sunday. Since they were one of the few Chinese restaurants open I give them a few stars. Otherwise the service was slow and inattentive, and both dishes we had were  bland. Oh well, we tried.
author: Jen L.

description:
My love affair with Brandy Ho's has been a long & consistent one. The only draw back is, it's a long distance love affair and everyone knows how difficult those are. "Brandy Ho's. Why are you so far away from me?"

Been coming here since I started dating my husband back in 1992. Back then we were always broke and could only afford the steamed dumplings and tea, but we always left happy just the same. We always make a stop at Brandy Ho's when we are visiting S.F. We have all of our friends & family hooked as well. 

Here are some of my favorites: 

~ Hot & Sour Soup
~ Hot & Sour Chicken
~ Kung Pao Chicken
~ Fried Spicy Dumplings (my hubby likes the steamed) 
~ Beef with green onion & wine sauce
~ Veggie Fried Rice

Yum, yum, yummy! It's 8:00am and I wanna eat this right now. I definitely left my heart in San Francisco. More specifically, at Brandy Ho's Hunan Food.
author: Lori B.

description:
I'm not a regular yelper, but this warrants a review.

Unfortunately, I decided to stray from my normal Chinese delivery. 

My roommate and I ordered a few different things... it all tasted exactly the same, and that isn't a good thing. It was bland, salty, mushy, and a total waste of money.  

I would have given it zero stars if I could, but I guess I have to admit the food showed up very quickly. Very fast delivery, but what is the point when you don't want to eat it? We threw most of it out.
author: Jordan R.

description:
They try to be a step up from Chinatown restaurants with the aesthetics and very good English skills but unfortunately it did not translate to the food. A little pricier than peers, B Ho has a large menu selection and authentic plates but I question the quality of their ingredients. The scallops tasted rubbery and sauces were mostly salty. 

Good for take out and very convenient but if you have some extra time, definitely go up a few more blocks for Chinatown soul food.
author: Ed L.

description: I went to this location for the first time the other day.  The interior is not as nice as the Castro location, but the service and food were good.  I ordered my usual steamed dumplings and Sliced Beef w/Curry Garlic & Hot Sauce and I told them to make it as SUPER MAJOR HOT AS POSSIBLE.  They obliged and I was sweating for 2 hours after I finished eating.  It was so good!  Totally hit the spot!
author: Shaun W.

description: The sauce is all the same!!! We had a big group and ordered 9 dishes. 7 of them had the same sauce. This is Chinese food for white people.
author: Julia S.

description:
Quite possibly the worst chinese food I have ever had... although being in SF 8 years I got lucky when i first moved here and being introduced to king ling. the most consistent and best portion for your dollar chinese in SF.  
Anyway, back to Brandys, portions are small for the price.
Sweet and Sour chicken- Horrible
Honey Walnut Prawns- worst i have ever had
Beef chow Mein- beef was good noodles are ok
Meat dumplings- taste like they are supposed to but a lot more dough than filling

I do have food credentials and am more picky than most having been a chef in this mecca of food cities.
author: Jason C.

description:
My boss loves Brandy Ho's, so we had a "business" lunch here last week. I had the fish fillet lunch special and it was the perfect amount of food. And reasonably priced at around $7. With the lunch special comes a few appetizers...sweet & sour soup, noodles with peanut sauce and the most delicious fried onion pancake. 

I cannot comment on the authenticity of the Hunan cuisine, I never lived in Hunan but I'd like to go back and try one of the signature dishes.
author: Sara P.

description:
Had heard this was THE place to go and that it was an SF establishment, so I was shocked to see a Groupon for it. I live in Berkeley but rarely make it across the bay. However, I was going to a conference there with friends from all over the country Flying in to attend so I thought it would be the perfect opportunity to try this place out. I called to make reservations since there was going to be around 12 people but we weren't positive when exactly we'd be able to get there. The woman was extremely accommodating and gave me a window of time. We showed up a little early with an extra person and our table was ready for us. That I definitely appreciated.

I ordered for the table and tried to mix up the protein. We also had one vegetarian so I wanted to make sure she had more than one dish. Ended up with a whole steamed fish, general's chicken, a spicy pork dish, dried fried green beans, garlic eggplant, a beef dish and we started with meat dumplings, veggie dumplings and egg rolls. All in all, the food was good but far from spectacular. For Hunan, it wasn't very flavorful or spicy. They brought two of each dish because the servings are pretty small. The pork was the spiciest and the eggplant the most flavorful. General's chicken was pretty standard Americanized fare - battered, gooey and sweet.

For out of towers who are unfamiliar with Chinese foo, this isn't a bad place to go. It's also pretty affordable for a big group. However, I, a Chinese girl living in Berkeley, will probably never go there again. Just not very exciting or good. I can think of many restaurants within a few miles of my house that are a lot better.
author: Kelly S.

description:
My favorite Chinese restaurant anywhere, simply stated.

If you're a fan of flavorful Chinese food, especially spicy, I highly recommend Brandy Ho's. Try the beef with green onions in white wine sauce, it's superb. Their lunch combo specials are a deal if you're there for that. If you just want to pick up or get delivery, they'll pack your food up in nice, reusable, plastic containers. All their dishes are quite reasonably priced.

The service is speedy with no rudeness, they set the standard and all other Chinese restaurants should pay attention and follow suit. 

Excellent...one of, if not my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Barrett I.

description: great chinese food, especially the lunch specials. good value and efficient service.
author: Cymba C.

description: One of the better lunch deals in town.  Also for a buck or two more you can pretty much substitute any dish you want.  Sitting at the bar close to the wok flames is always fun on a chilly day.
author: David W.

description:
Solid takeout Chinese food!  If you order online you are able to enter comments and ask for gluten free versions of most items on the menu.  I have had the fried rice (no soy sauce) and it super yummy.  Also had the shrimp and veggies (again gluten free).  
The delivery is always prompt and the food is fresh and hot upon delivery.
author: Julie C.

description: Imitation Chinese food .... some call it fusion, but I call it Americanized. The upscale decor is nice and it is clean. One may like it if they like PF Changs and Yujean Kangs.  it is good if you want to go someplace with a little nicer ambiance for Chinese food. I'll leave it for the tourists..... 1.5 stars
author: Shane S.

description:
I've been getting deliveries from here weekly for a couple of years now.  My favourite is the harvest pork.  The steamed dumplings are good, but make sure to ask for them to be made spicy.

We used to eat in here frequently a long time ago I don't think that they have bought new crockery since.
author: David H.

description:
My Santa Cruz friends want to eat here every time they visit SF.  I want to visit with them, so I endure the horrible food and surly service.  I've eaten here 4 times over the past 20+ years.

Food is consistently oily, greasy, not fresh, with too much dirty chili flavors in places it ain't supposed to be.

Waiters are downright nasty.

Another tourist torture zone on Columbus Ave.
author: Tom S.

description: Best Chinese food in Chinatown, especially for smoked meats and spicy dishes.
author: Kristopher T.

description:
Was in town for a convention, and wanted some Chinese food. Made a big mistake ordering from here! 

The Chinese Chicken Salad was horrendous -- nothing but rice noodles, cucumber and the thickest, yuckiest peanut sauce I've tasted. 

Brandy's Chow Mien is still sitting on the counter, uneaten. Greasy, and very little else but noodles. 

The only thing worth eating was the Hunan Gon-Pou Shrimp & Beef which had a good flavor. 

With so many other places to choose from, I'd suggest you move on and order somewhere else.
author: Larry S.

description:
I was so excited to finally try this place after hearing about it from friends for years!

Well the experience was just not great...the food did not taste good and it seemed like they had put some kid of curry powder in everything. The kung pao tasted horrible and so did the curry chicken. The best part was a duck dish we tried....a smoked duck.

Not coming back.
author: P From CA C.

description:
I've been going to Brandy Ho's for at least 20 years.  I switched from Henry Chung's "Hunan" when it got too trendy.  I've never looked back - Brandy Ho's has everything that makes great hunan chinese food - smoky, smoky meats, hot & sour soup, and as much "la jao" (hot sauce) as you can handle.  I love the fully open kitchen as well where you can see your meal being made without fear.

My recent visit was no different.  Wonderfully crunchy dumplings packed with meat and cabbage, smoked duck and several other items were prepared with love.

And no MSG.
author: Jim M.

description:
Brandy Ho, your reputation precedes you, and it was a good one, alas, my experience left me feeling icky. And I also felt like our waiter really didn't like us or at least did not want to be there that night. He actually scolded one of our party at one point for asking for a fork (you said just no, why you ask for one now?!). Um, yikes. 

Hunan is a region in sort of mid south eastern China, but I'm not sure what that means for the food. 

So hot and sour is one of my favs, but the hot and sour soup here was a little weird. I love super spicy food, but hot and sour soup is not supposed to be too spicy. I mean, it's not that super red pepper kind of hot. It really threw off the balance of the soup, it's supposed to be hot AND sour. Not just hot. And I never really thought the hot referred to spicy, either. I barely touched my soup and I would recommend you skip this. :(

The dumplings were actually quite good--surprisingly, I preferred the steamed to the fried. I should have spent my dinner calories on those. Also, the fried onion cake just did not live up to the hype and sort of reminded me of a tortilla.

Soooo, yikes, the smoked duck. I couldn't imagine duck bones were so big, but they're big and it's not so easy eat meat off bones with chop sticks (my failings, I know). The smoke flavor is so heavy, it almost smells like shoe leather or your fireplace. Dear god, no...it's upsetting my tummy thinking about it.

The "general chicken" which is what I heard them calling it was some strange sort of orange chicken like dish with a nice crispy texture, covered in an unpleasant, sweet glaze and sesame seeds. Broccoli on the side.

The best entree dish ordered was the Kung Pao Beef and Shrimp of which I only tasted the beef. This was a good, medium spicy dish with lots of onions and peanuts.

Overall though, the food was heavy, but not tasty enough to justify its weight. The waiter really did make us WAIT--at least 15 minutes between all the appetizers being taken off the table and coming back to take our order. He messed up our order twice and brought out the wrong things which we just accepted and paid for.

The atmosphere also left a lot to be desired, though my favorite part of this restaurant was the bathroom, which was impeccably clean!

PS. The girls at my high school named Brandy were pretty much all hos.
author: Jayi R.

description: I always look forward to the walnut shrimp when I stay with my son in the city. Most delivery is spotty, often cold and unreliable. Brandy hos is always hot, fast and delicious. On a rainy night like tonight, this is the best Chinese food delivery in the city.
author: Linda P.

description: Best Chinese food I've had!!! So delicious and not greasy! And they deliver late! Recommend this place to anyone.
author: Samantha M.

description: Best Chinese in SF, if you don't mind spicy! We used to go here all of the time years ago and took all of our out of town guests. Now we are the out of towners and couldn't wait to try it again after a long absence. The food did not disappoint. Service was prompt and attentive. We told them medium on the spice and it was just right. Sizzling rice shrimp was especially good. Steamed dumplings deserve special credit. And a good beer selection. It was fun having the kitchen so close too, making you feel right in the middle of the action.
author: Tom G.
